description:
This place is pretty small, but has enough tables for friends to hang out at. It seems like there's only one person working - she was the cashier and also the barista (she still made our drinks really quickly though). We also had our dogs with us, but she was nice enough to let us bring them in. 

I didn't know it was cash only, but luckily there were banks close by. We ordered the original black milk tea with boba (~$3-$4 for a large). The milk tea itself tasted good, with a stronger tea flavor and less sugar. But... the boba/pearls weren't soaked in honey long enough, so it made the overall drink taste different. 

Overall, I'd come back and order more drinks but without the pearls. I'm a fan of their milk tea and their customer service!
author: Aileen J.

description: Haha so it says Grand Opening on the sign but there are Yelp reviews since 2016. I was told this place has really good almond tapioca comparable to Wonderful Foods Co. I prefer Wonderful Foods Co. Basic milk tea wasn't anything to write home about either. Cash only. Overall, there are better boba shops out there but if you need to grab one it's not the worst spot.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Clement is a super busy street and this was my first time in this venue. 

I liked the fact that the drink was cheap $3 only which is among the lowest prices in the city.

However, the milk tea was pre-made and poured out of a plastic container which is always a warning sign for me. 

The resulting taste was as expected and for me was a little bit too strong. 

The boba surprising was not that bad. I have them at 3/4 for milk tea taste/boba taste in my ratings scale.  I also have them currently at #41 (of 47) in my SF/Daly City rankings below.

Rod M tours San Francisco area in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  I have a more comprehensive Tiered Bay Area boba list 104 boba spots and counting. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #42  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible

* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale.  A place could have a higher Yelp rating than it's boba score would imply , if it sells things other than Boba that are good. 

SF/Daly City Rankings:

1 Itea  2 Puppy bobar  3 Caffe Central  4 Cool Tea   5 The Boba Shop  6 Little Sweet  7 Good Earth Café  8 Hanlin Tea  9 Keep it  10 Wondertea  11 Enter the Café  12 Urban Ritual  13 Tpumps  14 The Ramen Bar  15 Eightea  16 Super Cue  17 Enter the Café  18 Steap (not Steep)  19 Tea Hut  20 Sharetea  21 Tanca  22 Boba Guys  23 Steep (not Steap)  24 Mr. & Mrs. Tea House  25 T&T Café  26 Bobo Drinks & Pho  27 Samovar Tea  28 5 sweets  29 Kestourine Macarons  30 Asha Tea House  31 E Tea  32 Little Heaven Deli  33 Maggies Café  34 Belly Good Café & Crepes  35 Tea Bear  36 Sweet Heart Café  37 Honeycreme  38 Elixiria  39 Quickly  40 Plentea  41 Sweethut  42 Mi tea  43 Ten Ren Tea  44 Wonderful Foods/Dessert & Café  45 Out the Door  46 I Café  47 Phusion  

Just a little taste of my greater Bay Area Tiers is below (there are 6 tiers I have in total, I've reviewed over 115 + boba spots now but obviously not enough room to list them all here) 

Rod's SF Bay Area Boba Tiers: This is based on my milk tea taste/ boba taste rating scale with 10/10 being the absolute best.  I have actual ranked lists for the South 880 corridor and San Francisco in case you're wondering. 
Tier 1 (Alphabetized) "Magnificent 4" aka" I'll get some even if I shouldn't..."
Bubbly, I-Tea, Pekoe, Teatop

Tier 2 : (Alphabetized) "The Almost Elite..but not quite" aka " I'm a fan but not a die hard" 
Caffe Central, Cool Tea, Factory Tea Bar, Good Earth Café,  Gong Cha, Hanlin Tea, Little Sweet, Passion  T snacks and Dessets Puppy Bobar, Soyful Desserts,  Tea Station ,The Boba Shop, 

Tier 3 (Alphabetized)  "The Above average spots" aka " Sure why not..let's roll" : 85 Degree, BlackBall Desserts, Bobapia, Cha Express, Che-Lo, Keep it, Super Cue, T4, Tastea, Tata Tea, Tea Six,  Tea Station, Teaspoon, Teatime, The Ramen Bar, T-Lab, Tpumps,Urban Ritual, Wondertea,
author: Rod M.

description: We were on Clement Street doing some shopping and decided to try this place since it said Grand Opening, and all the drinks were advertised as being 1.99.  I was very confused though that it said till 2012, but we thought maybe that was a misprint. When going in though we asked which drinks were 1.99 and found out the promotion was long ended.  Along with the rest of the reviewers we are very upset for the false advertising. We would not even had gone in there if it weren't for the sign. We decided not to even try out the place since the owner couldn't even take down the sign from 2012.
author: Nicole H.

description: This place had street parking so you might need to walk a bit wherever you find parking.  There was a lot of choices on the menu to choose from.  I chose the Tapioca Milk Tea ($2.75) and my dad chose the Avocado smoothie (I think).  The girl working here made both of our drinks after a few minutes.  They didn't use any powder or anything for the avocado and the tapioca milk tea like most other places.  The Tapioca Milk Tea tasted good to me and hit the spot after hiking around earlier in the day.  The pearls were also chewy so that was good.  Good milk tea here!
author: Daniel H.

description:
Nah, what a letdown. When I walked in, the place looks like they have just soft opened. Haphazardly arranged coutnertop, and some empty holes that were meant for toppings... 
AND some idle froyo machine in the back?? This place got some history..

OH and the bubble tea... SO unremarkable. I can even do that at home... 

***CASH ONLY*** Too

seriously, don't waste your money here
author: Chloe Z.

description:
Okay, I am super confused now.  Why is there a grand opening sign on the storefront when this place seems to have been open for at least a year now from the looks of all these review.  The other thing that confused me is why the  gigantic sign  hanging over the door outside says ALL DRINKS are $1.99 until 6-15-12 and I was told this was not the case when I was there on Mother's Day.  Since I was with my mother, I didn't make a stink because I didn't want to upset her.  If I was by myself, I would have demanded the promo price or gone across the street to the new boba tea place.  Instead, I sucked it up and I paid the $4 for my drink.  It's pretty crappy to have a huge banner out front to get customers in the door with false advertising.  (See my picture.)

The pineapple juice with boba and lychee gelee I had was thicker than I expected.  The juice was made from putting frozen pineapple in a blender so I get kept getting the stringy pulp in my mouth.  Since there was only one person making all the drinks, it also it took awhile to get mine.  And my sister's drink was ready but just left on the counter until I asked the cashier to hand it over after waiting a few minutes for it.    Moreover, the same woman was handling money at the cash register and ladling the boba into our drinks.  That seems like unsanitary food handling to me.  Do you know how many germs can be found on money?  

And I am also turned off by the fact that they couldn't even make the effort to hide all the previous frozen yogurt furnishings.  Obviously, I am never going back.
author: Jeannette W.

description:
Disappointed all around. Customer service and actual items.

To start off they are still in their grand opening phase so you would think that they would want to be extra friendly to everyone since they have some competition right down the street from Mr. and Mrs. Teahouse and Quicklys but the lady who was there when I went was so stand offish and not very welcoming.

I only wanted to order the fried calamari but she said they weren't offering it because the cook isn't there and has already left for the day but they are open for another 3 or 4 hours. Not very smart on their part because deep fried stuff is a really common late night snack that people go out for.

As for the avocado milkshake I ordered, I asked how sweet it is and she said I can decide so I told her really sweet and it tastes like she didn't really make it that sweet. On top of that, I can tell they don't flavor their boba with honey or anything.

I think I'll use my other options from now on.
author: Laura Y.

description:
Warning, this review might be tmi!

I was across the street at Green Apple Books, and had to go to the bathroom bad. I decided to try my luck here, and the woman behind the counter handed me the bathroom key with no mention of "customers only" or "you have to buy something first," which i genuinely appreciated!

I decided to get something even though I didn't really want anything as a "thank you." I got the coffee tapioca, less sweet. The tapioca balls aren't the best (a little hard for my taste) but the taste of the coffee drink was perfect. Extra star for the gracious service!
author: Emma A.

description: The strawberry boba here is life changing! It's made with fresh strawberries and they put just the right amount of boba in it. You can't beat the price either for this delicious  goodness. This is my go to place for consistent delicious boba. It is cash only so make sure you come prepared.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
This place is the same owners as Wonderful Foods on Irving street. I've been a fan since they opened Wonderfuls and I'm so happy they opened one in the Richmond closer to my home. I always come here for their fruit smoothie boba because it is all freshy and super tasty! The tapioca balls are also perfect sweetness and chewiness. Their popcorn chicken is also very yums! However, they ONLY ACCEPT CASH - so be sure to come with that ready. Service is always awesome too - friendly and does it with a smile. Definitely returning :)

Some of my favorite drinks:
- Strawberry Smoothie with tapioca
- Avocado Smoothie with tapioca
- Hot milk tea with tapioca
- fresh taro
- lychee
author: Amanda C.

description:
note: all my friends have this a 4/5 but im very particular about boba so i gave them a 3. 


My friends and were going to head into mr mrs, my friends favorite place but they were closed for the fourth so we headed here. As with most of clement it is CASH ONLY so dont be like us and sprint back to our house to get the remaining $9 in cash we needed. The staff were all very gracious about our disorder. 

As far as the drinks went we got the taro slush, which i didnt love. My friend loved it though. My brother said it tastes like lactase enzyme. whatever that means. i thought it tasted too much like milk.

The strawberry tapioca was good and what one would expect. I liked that they used fresh fruit.

I ordered lychee with lychee jelly (not bad. very hard and sweet) and boba (okay. stuck together). They put a ton of toppings in. I liked it but it was way too sweet.

I definitely liked it and they did have a lot of options to try but i dont know if i would go out of my way to come back.


(check out my profile to see other reviews f boba in sf and elsewhere)
author: Boba R.

description: I just love how they put crushed ice in their drinks! I just despise huge cubes! My almond jelly milk tea was delicious. They made it quick. The almond jelly tastes like almonds and the milk tea had the perfect strength of black tea. It wasn't too milky and didn't taste generic or like powdery mix at all!
author: Tina R.

description:
I stumbled upon this place while on my way to the nearby Richmond New Way Mah Supermarket, which is only two blocks west. I got the matcha with boba, which was $3.50 (including tax) for 16oz. Definitely one of the cheaper bobas I've had since coming to SF! (Admittedly, I have been frequenting some expensive areas of SF.) It is cash only though.

The drink itself was okay. They blend the ice into the drink, which is a bit of a different approach from other places, and means that sometimes you get a little chunk of ice as you drink. The matcha itself was decent. I like the flavor better than some of the other places I've tried recently (Bottle Zup and Plentea) but it's not on the same level as my favorite places in SF, flavor-wise (Asha Tea House and Boba Guys). The boba was nice and chewy, and for the price, I am pretty satisfied! Bonus star for the price-to-taste ratio.
author: Stephanie H.

description: Lychee Milktea Tapioca is my go to. Fried chicken is worth the wait! I have been going the the sister store Wonderful on Irving for the past 15 years. YUM!
author: Melissa K.

description:
Drink: Pretty decent boba for a good price. I ordered the blended mocha. The boba had a good texture and taste and the coffee was good. Considering it was blended AND the price included boba for less than $4, I was pretty impressed and pleasantly surprised (drink was $3.75.

Service: No complaints. Always nice when they're willing to answer questions. 

Ambiance: Has a good amount of seating. Lots of tables for two. Clean and colorful.
author: Susan G.

description:
Came here with my brother and friend. When we first walked, we smelled so much sweetness. Its kinda weird that this place still had that self-serve frozen yogurt so you'll see some empty topping area by the cashier. You'll see some toppings but it'll cost extra if you want to add it unless the drinks already coming the toppings. I thought its weird how they have some buckets of tapioca on the counter by the toppings. I would thought they would put those in the back. 
This store had the grand opening sign at the front that said all drinks are $1.99 until 6/15/15 and when came in today which is 6/3/15. Totally misleading about the grand opening discount price of the drinks.

Got the lychee tapioca milk tea for 3.25. It was alright. Nothing special. But i like that its overpowering of the sweetness with good amount of boba though. It does come with some lychee since its a lychee tapioca milk tea.

Cash only
author: Julie N.

description:
So I have to admit, my bar standard is Fantasia when it comes to milk tea. This place doesn't even compare, but then again, not a lot of other places do.

I got the regular milk tea, sesame milk tea for the madre, and popcorn chicken. Milk tea tasted like coffee, while I think they put too much sesame in our other drink. After a few minutes, you could see a layer of sesame just sitting there. Popcorn chicken was pretty good, but felt like it took awhile for them to make. By the end, though, it felt a little like overkill.

I walked by there again today, but wasn't in the mood for just okay boba. If you're REALLY craving boba and need a quick fix asap while you're in the area, this might do the trick. However, it's not a place worth driving out of the way for.
author: Daisy Y.

description:
I hate to say this, but the quality of Sweethut has declined drastically. When it first opened (4 years ago; don't be misled by the old awning/banner up front), this was my absolute favorite tea spot ever. The black milk tea with ice cream was a specialty and completely delicious. They originally wanted to do froyo too, but the permit was never obtained (which is why you see empty wells on the counter where the toppings would be, plus gaps in the wall where the machines would be). 

Fast forward to today and the place isn't as well kept anymore. The furniture is showing its age. The ice cream milk tea has stayed consistently good, but the other flavors don't taste quite right. The popcorn chicken with basil is a nice snack though, if you don't mind the wait.
author: Brittany L.

description:
Back when I lived in Pac Heights, this was the closest place for boba cravings. I heard they're the same owners as WonderfulFoods (one of my fave boba places) and my eyes just sparkled.

They had just opened, and their jasmine milk tea was only $1.99! Heyyoooo! But now that it's been a while since they opened, not sure if that price is still available, but you only saved a few cents anyways. If anything their teas are around $3, pretty cheap to me and average price. My friend really likes their avocado smoothie. Their boba has always been a consistent perfect for me. They also serve snacks.

Their service is pretty fast. The only downside is that it's pretty spacious inside but they only have tables for 2. And they don't have that many of them either. They're also set up for frozen yogurt, not sure if that's up and running yet.

Oh yes, and it's all street parking in Richmond district and if I remember correctly, it's cash only.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I only tried one drink so I can't compare it to their other drinks. From what I hear this place is owned wonderful foods. I do like wonderful foods and it's great that there's another decent boba place on clement! 

Honeydew tapioca :3/5: it didn't taste extremely special, it tasted pretty similar to vitasoy. Even though it wasn't special, I still liked it. 

Im definitely willing to come back, I want to try their watermelon juice tapioca!

Total: $3
author: Stella J.

description: Jiggly balls had this rancid sour taste to it that made me feel like throwing up. Worst tasting boba balls ever.  I ordered the chocolate banana with balls and the only thing good about this drink was that they used fresh bananas to make it.  Otherwise, it was a terrible waste of my money buying this drink.
author: Jenny T.

description: I usually come here when I'm wandering around clement. The drinks are so refreshing and I'm constantly back for their watermelon juice. I'm always down to try something new because it always ends up good anyway. I liked the strawberry mango smoothie. However, I'm not really a fan of the pearls because they're softer than I prefer. Going to be still coming here a lot. Friendly service as well, decent prices, and real fruit
author: Maggie W.

description: I ordered a taro boba drink.   The drink color is purple.   But it taste like almond drink. Please make sure you guys wash your mixer.  Lol
author: Chris L.

description: I came here because one of my friend recommended me to try this place, and alll i cannn sayyyyy issssssss this is my new spot! The person that was making my drink was patience with me, im usually picky about the sweetness and the way the drinks are made but she made it happen! Just the wayyy i like it. Thankk youu sooo muchhh sherry!
author: Jay L.

description: Ew. I went there tonight to get an oolong milk tea with boba and it was so gross. I don't know what happen to this place but the tea tasted water down and the boba was overlooked. The pearls texture seemed like it was melted and soft, not chewy at all. With so many tea options nearby I should have ventured further to ShareTea instead. I couldn't even finished my drink. What a waste. Very disappointed.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
3.5 Stars is about right on this boba stop! I came here with a major hankering for boba and it was about 35% satiated after having the boba here..

I ordered the almond jelly milk tea with boba! The boba was cheap..only $2.99! BUT..the boba was not a good consistency. It was a bit too mushy on the outside..I'm thinking it was just soaking too long.

The milk tea was good, nothing spectacular..not "tea" flavored enough, but not too sweet (which is most common among boba shop offenders). :) The almond jelly was DELISH though, i must say. A lot of places that do almond jelly don't really make the jelly flavorful enough. The almond jelly here would be worth a 4-star rating..but everything else just took it down a notch!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
This place is pretty good. Their milk teas are $3.25 and only accepts cash (so please bring a few in the future). 

This location is directly next door to Schubert's Bakery. So it works for them, I would think - at least in my case. 

I needed something cool to drink after finding hectic parking around Clement St just to get the birthday cake I ordered. Lo and behold, this new milk tea location oh so conveniently located beside the cake store.

I went in - looks like they just opened - and ordered a coconut milk tea for $3.25. At the first taste, it seems like they use real fruit. It really tastes like coconut! 
It makes me want to know what the others taste like.
author: Nina M.

description:
A generous scoop of soft, chewy boba goes into the plastic cup.

Add black tea that is nicely balanced and not too overpowering.

In goes some ice. 

Pop the cover, stick a straw in the hole. (TWSS?) 

Suck as hard as you can. 

Fill your mouth with boba. 

Chew. 

Swallow. 

Repeat. 

Guaranteed instant gratification for only $2.50!
author: Janice C.

description:
I rarely get asian drinks of any kind (unless it's sake or chinese moonshine) because I'm a terrible fob asian, but the avocado shake was on point, and the boba had a consistent chewiness with a light sweetness.

Green milk tea was just okay, a little too sweet.

Hella cheap.
author: Tian Q.

description:
Pretty good milk tea though they definitely use powder for their drinks rather than actual tea leaves. 

I ordered the mint green tea (half-sweet) and it was yummy :) The mild minty taste blended really well with the green tea. I liked that the mint wasn't too overpowering and less syrup gave it the slightly bitter sweet taste that I like of my tea :)

My sister ordered the plum green tea and she really enjoyed it as well. They also included 2 little plums in her drink which was a nice touch! 
http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/J_fb83Z4xSNaXKzX-kxrCg/l.jpg

Service was really great-the guy behind the counter was friendly & efficient considering he was the one ringing us up & mixing our drinks. No wait when we came since we were the first party to sit in but it got a little busier afterwards.

They have a decent amount of indoor seating! I suggest that you grab some delicious Chinese pastries from a nearby bakery, order some boba, & chill with yo friends ^^

$3 each for our tea (no boba) which is definitely pricier than Quickly but I'd take Sweethut over Quickly's watered-down sugar drinks any day. They have specials for plain milk tea & flavored milk tea if you like milk in your tea :)
author: June Y.

description:
Because I've been in LOVE with Wonderful Foods since I was a young one, their sister store in the Sunset district, I decided to finally make a trip out to the Richmond and try Sweethut! They pretty much offer the same drinks as Wonderful Foods, but for some reason their prices are about 25-50 cents cheaper here. A milk tea with pearls here is 2.50, which isn't bad and I would pay that any day considering how well the quality of their milk tea is! Too bad I missed out on their special of 1.99 milk teas.. what a steal! My sister got their papaya smoothie boba drink around 3.50. They used real papaya and blended it into a well consistency. I'm not a huge fan of papaya, but my sister liked it a lot. The pearls here are just how I like it, sweetened and just the right amount of chewiness. All drinks here come with pearls, or you can substitute for jellies or whatever they have in their little topping "bar" on the side for an extra $.50. 

The service here is just as good as at Wonderful Foods. What I like more about this place is that there is actually some seating here so you have somewhere to just sit and chill instead of being forced to awkwardly stand in the shop and all that. No candy selection here. Also, cash only!!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
I've been to wonderful foods and like their teas. I read that Sweethut has the same owner so I decided to give it a try.  

The decor is nice and modern. The guy who made my drink was super quick. I think it might we've be a lil cheaper here. Passion green tea with boba $2.99. Same quality too!

They Will be getting frozen yogurt soon!
author: Thuy N.

description:
First off, incredibly misleading sign out front. Having the attention span of a goldfish, I only read the first part which said grand opening all drinks $1.99... and then failed to read the second part which said until 6/15/12... Hats off to you boba shop-you have bested me today.

I ordered a large strawberry green tea with boba for $4.25. Loved the strawberry bits which were probably part of the syrup, but the green tea had been brewed too long, so the drink overall had an unpleasant bitterness. The tapioca was also pretty decent-chewy and sweet. 

Overall, because of the sign and the fact that the "tea" in my "strawberry green tea" was not brewed well, 3/5 stars in my book. In a mini china town, you can probably do better.
author: Daffodil L.

description: My lychee drink was ok.  It quenched my thirst, it satiated my boba drink craving, but it was a bit too chunky on the bottom after I drank all the liquid.  The boba taste and consistency was ok.  I would get it again though if I was in the area and I really wanted a boba drink.
author: Maile N.

description: Really clean and cute place. Flavors could use to taste better though. The wulong milk tea and the mint green milk tea tasted subpar and I wished I got it from somewhere else. My friend told me my mint milk tea tasted like mouthwash and the wulong reminded her of some weak corn silk drink. My friends liked their drinks though.
author: Crystal R.

description:
It's hard to be Asian and not crave boba after every meal. haha jk.

Stopped by here after a spicy meal to quench my thirst. Got a strawberry green tea with boba - price includes boba and it was the one day I didn't want any, but for some reason I got some anyways.

They're really generous with their boba portion, but unfortunately I was dissapointed. The boba was hard - probably overcooked. The strawberry green tea part was not bad. I could actually taste some real strawberries in my drink. A tad on the sweet side though.

Overall, I probably wouldn't come back unless I was absolutely craving.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
Boba craving led me here yesterday. 
Sad to say I am disappointed though.
However looking at the reviews on Yelp, I guess they were having an off-day yesterday. 

Ordered a cheapie green milk tea - pretty standard drink.
Boba: bland and hard tapioca balls :(
Tea: Did not taste like real tea at all - must be made from a syrup blend?
Awkward green milk tea color

0.5 stars extra for their ice - I like how it's small icy particles, vs huge ice cubes other places give.

Overall for that drink - I'd rate it 2.5 :(

For the overall experience I'd give the place a 3 - since it was clean for the most part, bright, and hard to miss when you walk or drive by....also because a certain mister claims Sweethut is one of his top 3 boba places in San Francisco - so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.

Overall 3 stars. Would recommend to a friend? Maybe...but I'd have to try more things to confirm a yes or a no.
author: Lynn L.

description:
This is your typical boba place.  I ordered the honeydew milk tea.  It was made in less than 2 minutes.  There was nothing worthwhile about the taste.  However, there was nothing negative to say about it.  I would not go out of my way to get a drink from this place.  But if I was really thirsty, I would probably give this place another shot.  

Their banner outside the store really upsets me.  It promises a discount from 2012.  This is completely unacceptable, misleading, and outdated.  Take it down; it is just so tacky.
author: Victor L.

description:
I came here during the $1.99 grand opening promotion about three times.  I got a banana strawberry tapioca drink, fresh "honeydew" tapioca drink, and mango coconut milk tapioca drink.
I really liked the banana strawberry tapioca!  It had a strong banana taste.
I waited for quite a while for the honeydew drink and I think they gave me cantaloupe... but I didn't realize until I left because I was in a rush.  I prefer honeydew milk tea at other places more.
The mango coconut milk tapioca was very good!  It's $4.25 at the normal price, so thank goodness I got it during the promotion!
The tapioca is very chewy.  I always ask for lite ice.  There are a limited amount of tables and chairs.  There were froyo machine spots, but I'm guessing it had not been filled yet.  This is a good tapioca spot in the Richmond.  I will come back soon to try more drinks at the regular price.

-- Strawberry Milkshake is delicious! :)
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
Yummy...coconut boba. Nomnomnom.
Also, I could bring my dog inside, which I loved because I hate seeing my little pooch sit outside in the cold.
author: Julianna I.

description: This place is good, depending on what you order. I am not a fan of their teas, but their smoothies are good. Hey use fresh fruit, which is awesome. I always get the avocado, watermelon, strawberry, and honeydew smoothies. The consistency of their boba is nice and chewy. Their popcorn chicken is delicious! The owner is also very nice. The staff have all been friendly. Overall a great, no frills place. We like!
author: N N.

description:
$1.99 for milk tea with boba.  It was horrible.  Balls were a little too chewy.  Didn't taste like fresh milk tea.

This was our last resort since my favorite Boba place was packed.  There are times like these when you shouldn't settle....
author: Linda N.

description:
I remember back when the boba craze first flared up in SF, this stretch of Clement had some slim pickings for tasty milk tea.  And by slim, I really mean none.  Crazy considering this area is supposed to be New Chinatown/Chinatown Junior/Mini Chinatown/whateveryouwanttocallit.  Quickly made for an acceptable stop gap, but I'm so glad there's better boba to devour in the area now.  Helloooooo Sweethut!

The semi-newborn sister of Wonderful Foods (my favorite boba joint in SF), Sweet Hut is more of a typical boba joint than places like Purple Kow (they don't really have the chubby cups or a lot of the "dessert drinks").  Nothing wrong with the basics though!  I ordered a regular Boba Milk Tea and it tasted just as good as what I get from Wonderful Foods.  The tapioca has a great consistency, they use just the right amount of syrupy sweetness, and the milk tea itself has a good balance of cream/milk and tea.  Just spot on good!

So why only four stars, when I gave Wonderful Foods five?  Because I haven't tried my other favorites here yet!  Once I know they can do those just like how their big sister can, they'll easily earn that fifth star.  Sweethut, the Inner Richmond has been needing someone like you for so long!
author: Mike L.

description:
I was planning on taking my friend to Kowloon Tong since I love it there but we walked by it and saw it was closed.  In search for a boba place on Clement on Yelp but found Sweethut.  He was on the phone but asked the guy if they had a cantaloupe milk tea and the guy said they did so he made it for him.  I got a strawberry and banana smoothie both with some tapoica.  Total was only $5!  I liked my strawberry and banana smoothie and the tapoica was nice and soft but not to soft where it was mushy.  His drink ended up not being milk tea just a cantaloupe smoothie...we didn't like it.  

Sweethut is a good choice if you're craving a boba drink and don't want to go to nearby Quickly's; their drinks are usually too sweet anyways!
author: Cat C.

description: As a new resident of SF, I was told that Richmond had all the authentic Chinese spots. This is probably worse than most of the bubble teas I've had in the financial district, soma or mission. The bubbles were too soft and the tea felt like it was made from cheap tea bag and not tea leaves. I will not be going back to this place for bubble tea.
author: Rohenne L.

description: Cashier was really friendly and welcoming. Taro taps tasted good; however, the sign outside that says $1.99 and grand opening should be removed: it is now 2015, 2012 was 3 years ago! Very misleading
author: Cheryl P.

description:
Sweethut has pretty decent milk tea & boba.

I came here because I was super thirsty on a sunny day. The location is good, thanks to the many restaurants on Clement--perfect for satisfying your Chinese food, dim sum, and milk tea cravings all in one trip :) There were a few people seated inside and no line--yay! This made me especially happy because I was in a bit of a rush!

I ordered a lychee milk tea with boba. I liked the milk tea, and the lychee pieces were chopped up small enough that they easily went up the straw. The tapioca pearls were okaaay, a bit more chewy/overcooked than I normally prefer. Not bad though. I'd come here again. The price was decent as well; the regular size cost me $2.99.

The place is a bit dark inside and the chairs looked uncomfortable, but I'd come here again nonetheless. Service was fast and friendly. They also opened very recently, and I noticed froyo machines on the side :) I think that'll be a nice addition!
author: Leanne C.

description:
Maybe I came on an off time, but I found their system to be super inefficient/slow. However, there were only 2 workers so props to them for holding down the fort with a huge line inside. 

I had the passion green tea with boba. It was good, not too sweet and it wasn't filled with tons of ice (sometimes a cop out to serve less). I enjoyed it. I was just eh about the 20 min wait when there was only 1 other person in front of me.

I'd be willing to come back again and give it another chance. I'll just make sure I'm not in a hurry, just in case.
author: Noelle H.

description:
Not bad for a tapioca shop. I was in the hood and wanted a sweet drink so I headed over to Sweethut for something to satisfy.

The girls behind the counter were very sweet and friendly (I am quite surprised by the amount of positive customer service I have been receiving as of late at these boba shops). I ordered a jasmine milk tea with boba. The drink wasn't too sweet and wasn't too bland.

I'll be back when I'm in the hood.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Sweethut has replaced Sweet Delite Gourmet Foods Co. This new tapioca place seems a little smaller, though it's more colorful, vibrant, and welcoming. According to other yelpers, Sweethut is owned by Wonderful Foods Co from the Outer Sunset, which I don't find surprising because the drink flavors are very similar and they use the same type of cups and shaved ice.

My top two drink flavors are regular milk tea and Thai tea. I've tried both flavors at Sweethut, and they were delicious with just the right amount of sweetness and creaminess. However, the tapioca balls were a huge disappointment here. Maybe I came on an off-day, but the tapioca balls were undercooked, too chewy and tasteless. 

The staff is friendly and very quick with preparing drink orders. The place is very clean, and there are several tall tables and seats against the wall -- a definite perk compared to Wonderful Foods Co, where they only have two small tables.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Every time I visit San Francisco, Sweet Hut is my place to go to for some good ol' milk tea. The drinks here tastes exactly like Wonderful's (I believe they're the same owners?) but even cheaper. Their milk tea has a really unique flavor, like there's a hint of coffee in it, which is the perfect combination for me and always makes me come back wanting more.  Parking may be annoying around this area, but I'll do anything for some delicious non-diluted milk tea. 

I really recommend this place for all boba loving fans. Way better than Teaway or Purple Kow! No long wait or rude cashiers either!
author: MyTien P.

description: We were in the area for dinner and I was in the mood for some boba for dessert, so we walked down Clement hoping to find some good options. We walked by Quickly which is usually consistently good, but it was permanently closed, so we kept walking... then found this place. The shop was about to close in a few minutes, but the guy working behind the counter waved us in. We ordered the papaya milk shake and the avocado shake, both with boba, and both turned out to be excellent! You can taste the real fruit in the drink, and we loved that it's not too sweet like the ones you would get at most boba tea shops. They were generous with the amount of boba added to the drinks, and even at the end of the day the boba tasted fresh with nice chewy consistency. The man working there (probably the owner) was super nice and friendly, gave helpful recommendations and chatted with us while preparing our drinks. So glad we found this place randomly, I'll definitely be coming back!
author: Sarah W.

description:
The boyfriend and I visited Sweethut for a sweet dessert following dinner nearby. The place itself isn't all too big but they have all of the standard milk tea and slushy drinks you'd expect, and a variety of boba and jelly.

We shared the honeydew with boba and it was $2.99. The drink was nicely blended and had the right amount of flavor and sweetness. The boba was soft, yet chewy. Overall, the drink was just as I expected it to be. The prices are pretty fair and the staff seemed pretty friendly. The place seems clean, especially since it seems a bit bare (furniture is very simple). I wish it was cozier inside so that I could sit and lounge around- but I just took it to go.
author: Samantha L.

description:
Upon walking in, I was unimpressed. The space is small, stuffy, and poorly lit. There are a couple tables with several chairs scattered randomly- a very inefficient use of space.

I ordered unsweetened black tea with grass jelly (they ran out of aloe!!). The tea was poured from a pre-made batch in a plastic tub, so I'm not sure if it's real tea or powdered tea... The grass jelly was decent, but can't really mess up on that I guess.  

Bf ordered honey green tea with boba. The tea was a bit sweet, but decent.

Overall, will probably not return unless I happen to be in the area and have a sudden, intense tea craving.
author: Samantha C.

description: I love these guys! I usually order the salt & pepper chicken (aka popcorn chicken, chicken on a stick) spicy. It's take about 5-7 min but it comes fresh with basil for only $5. So amazingly delicious!! I can't have this without their unmatched milk tea boba that comes "shaken, not stirred" from their bar setup. Again, you can't go wrong here. After trying this place, I'm never going back to Quickly, their boba tastes so powdery after you have the real deal here.
author: Brandon V.

description: This place is cute. And they made a good coffee milk tea. The girl in front if me ordered a couple of drinks and modified the hell out of them, so this place is super accommodating. I ordered something simple and had no complaints. Can't wait to come back and try some other drinks.
author: Elena N.

description:
I was in the neighborhood, craving milk tea, and happened upon Sweethut while searching Yelp. The milk green tea I ordered immediately invoked a sense of familiarity, which I later recognized as being the same flavor profile I get further south, down at Wonderful Foods Company, owned by the same folks.

So, the same review stands between the two places: while their milk green isn't the best I've had, for what I've tried in the area, they're certainly not bad, and it beats making my way down to Ten Ren in the South Bay, or waiting in the crazy lines at places like Purple Kow.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Shouldn't be an issue. And while limited, the seating consists of your usual two/three-seater cafe tables, so don't expect to be able to pull up completely under them.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out, so I can't comment.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Came by for a drink the other day and it was surprisingly good, although a tad too sweet.

Ordered the Tapioca Milk Tea and pearls were included for $1.99

The pearls were very chewy and sweet.

The tea was decent too.

The owner has a petition at the register requesting his ability to sell froyo too...
author: Derek S.

description:
I didn't have much high expectations for this place mostly because their banner in the front was super old. Well don't judge a book by its cover. Lol.

I ordered the WuLong Milk Tea Tapioca & Passion Fruit Green Tea Tapioca. Both are good. It was just strange watching the girl behind the counter make my drink because I saw how much simple syrup (I assume since it was clear) and pre made flavor was dumped into a mixing cup & shaken together. 

None the less this place isn't bad. The boba isn't too tough either. The prices are decent here too. I'd come back.
author: Ruhjeenuh Z.

description:
Okay, okay, let me start by telling you...although, I've been here a few times I lucked out on finding a great drink the first time I went and I haven't tried any other. Why mess with my yummy tummy fav????

I'm not going to comment on decor, as it is very plain & simple like most others in the city that specialize in this type of drink. I read in another review they are planning on getting ice cream, which would make sense as they have the setup for it. Basically, it looks like an ice cream place w/o the ice cream...I'm guessing they cook their tapioca ahead of time (I don't know the fine points if tapioca prep), as there is always a huge stew pot of tapioca they scoop from. From an aesthetic's point-of-view, it would be nice if it was in a more presentable fashion, bit that's neither here not there.

I get mango w/ coconut milk & tapioca...It's such a delightful treat after work, as I pass this place up on my way home. They are always super quick with their preparation..although, it would be great if it had lil bits if fruit in it like Sharetea (just a thought)
author: Eboniña E.

description: Person at the counter was not friendly. I ordered through eat24 for pick up and eat24 customer service later contacted me saying they tried contacting the business for 10 minutes with no success and could not confirm the order. That they weren't notified by the business that they were closed so gave me the option to either cancel the order or go to the business and see if they were going to make the order. From my memory, I thought they are usually always open so I chose to go to the location and check. When I arrived at the location, the guy at the counter was messing with his phone but then atttended to me. I showed him with my phone that I had submitted an order through eat24 for pick up and all he said was no, cash only. My order didn't show that I had paid through paypal/credit card and he didn't say ok, I'll do the order but you have to pay in cash so I assumed that he meant they don't accept orders through eat24 at all. There was no sorry or anything or offer to do anything so I left awkwardly. I then had to call back eat24 customer service to have them cancel the payment. Eat24 customer service was surprised to hear that they did not honor my order and that the business has not cancelled their service with them. I haven't ordered drinks from this place for a long time but it seems as if business has changed here. I will not be returning but eat24 customer service is excellent so you can trust eat24 but I just want to warn others not to order through eat24 for this business.
author: M L.

description: I saw that this place had good ratings and since I was in the area, I stopped by to get milk tea. The tapioca milk tea was part of a special and was only $1.99. My cousin wanted the Green Apple Tea, which looked so green I thought it could glow in the dark. lol. The tapioca milk tea was pretty good. The tea flavor was pretty strong and they gave us a lot of tapioca pearls, which I like. This milk tea place might still be new so even though they have frozen yogurt machines, they still don't have the supplies for it yet. Hopefully they will start soon. I'd love to come back and try the frozen yogurt. There's not that many places in the Richmond area with frozen yogurt so it'd be nice to have a new addition. This place is also cash only.
author: Andrea G.

description:
I came in for fresh watermelon juice with aloe.  I ordered, paid and waited.  It wasn't until after I already paid and was waiting for a few minutes that the cashier tells me that they were out of aloe.  I wouldn't have ordered had I known that in advance, but because I already paid, I told him I'd be fine with lychee jelly.  

It took a good 10 minutes for the drink to come out.  What were they doing?  Growing their own watermelons back there?  When I make it at home, it takes me a 2 minute thanks to my Magic Bullet.  They have commercial blenders here!  

That being said, my drink tasted pretty decent.  It would have been better with aloe, though.  And I wish they didn't use sugar in my fresh fruit juice.
author: Jenny L.

description:
I stopped in here to get a bubble tea while running errands. This place us super clean and there were a lot of options. They even have soy milk! I ordered a delicious banana and chocolate bubble tea with soy milk and it was delicious. The person I was with ordered a mango tea and they served it with fresh mango juice, which changes the flavor dynamic. It was good as well, but not the mango flavor I'm used to with bubble teas. It's not the best bubble tea in town, but it's really good and priced well!

Oh, and It's cash only!
author: Scott C.

description:
The milk tea was great. Tapioca fresh and strawberry wasn't too sweet or over powering. Had it after dinner in the area on the way home so it was a perfect pit stop.

Only $3.25 too, so won't break the bank.

Lose a star as it looked like it used to be a yogurt shop and semi-converted it. Still some weird features but nothing that would stop me from goin back.
author: Kyle C.

description:
I'm surprised that Sweethut is owned by Wonderful Foods. The milk tea is much better at Wonderful Foods. Sweethut has 65 kinds of drinks, including milk tea, fresh fruit tapioca drinks (including durian and taro), slushes, yogurt drinks, grass jelly, etc. You can add tapioca pearls, jellies, pudding, and aloe vera to the drinks. The drinks are currently $1.99 (till June 15th). They also have a small selection of fried snacks. Sweethut doesn't have the candies and dried snacks that Wonderful Food carries.

* #18 Wulong milk tea: Brewed Oolong tea, milk, sweetener and pearls are hand shaken. The pearls were not fresh. They had a gooey texture on the outside. The pearls were lightly sweetened, firm and chewy. The milk tea had a strong, bitter overbrewed tea flavor. It wasn't creamy/milky and they actually didn't add enough sugar (normally I think milk tea drinks are too sweet). 

They're going to have fro-yo in the future...self-serve, 4 machines. I wonder if the fro-yo will be the same as what they offered at Wonderful Yogurt? I hope not.
author: Lolia S.

description: The girls were really friendly. The tapioca was nice and soft and their fresh strawberry smoothie is delicious!!!
author: Danielle A.

description:
Sweethut sells fried snacks, all kinds of drinks (milk tea, fresh fruit, slushes, yogurt drinks) you can do add-ons but with the lines. i passed on it.

currently all drinks (1.99) till 6/15. cashier takes the order, hands the order to 2 associates who assembles it.

drink: jasmine milk tea
-made by pouring liquids from various bottles together
-boba has chewy texture.
-tea had subtle taste, it was mostly milk.
-didn't appreciate the crushed ice in the drink.
-2.5 for meh

drips:
-no seating available, just grab & go.
-metered parking.
author: Victor G.

description:
Get boba-faced. 

Wonderful Foods Co location #2 takes over Sweet Delite's old spot... I won't have to drive that extra distance to Sunset!

I miss Sweet Delite but this is as good as the original Wonderful location. Who can say no?

Wonderful Foods Co is a far better name than Sweethut. Because "sweet hut" consists of two words. Because the Sweethut sign looks like it reads "sweethot." Because it sounds like a fob saying "sweetheart" and not quite succeeding. And because somehow I keep seeing the word "slut" in it. 

...but what's in a name? Wonderful Foods by any other name tastes as sweet(hut). 

I stick with #1 (boba milk tea) religiously... but their passion fruit and lychee options are not bad either.  I tried to the taro once and didn't love it (both smoothie, which was made w/ real taro, and slushy, which was made with artificial taro).  If you're coming here, you should be getting the tea.  My friend's mango coconut was fresh and tasty though!

All drinks $1.99 till June 15.
author: Erika C.

description:
This wasn't a bad place at all. Pretty cool actually since it's in the heart of sub Chinatown area. There's a lot of swanky places and what not, but this is definitely a place to check out for bubble tea around that area. I thought the tea was actually pretty good that they use to make it. However I also realized that they use half and half for all their milk drinks. So lactose people be aware!!!

You might need to use the bathroom :) Overall it was awesome. Definitely check it out for old school boba.
author: Nathan L.

description:
A nice attempt at a bubble tea shop, this place is meant to be a grab and go as the seats aren't comfortable nor made for groups to hang out. What a shame.

Ask for half of the tapioca! There's way too much put in to enjoy the size.
author: Regina D.

description:
I was waiting anxiously for this place to open since I lived just a few blocks away. When it did, it did not disappoint!

I usually get the strawberry smoothie. They use real fruits! The husband usually gets mango. $2.50 gets you a generous scoop of perfect boba and a cup of nicely blended fruits.

The regular items on the menu are a bit pricey. Stick with the specials, milk teas for $1.99 and smoothies for $2.50. I tried the milk tea and wasn't in love with it, sad to say. I'd still go down the street to D&A Cafe for milk tea. Order the fruity drinks and you can't go wrong!
author: Sara K.

description:
After eating dim sum (few stores down) I saw the Sweethut and the promotion they had "1.99 for all drinks until 6/15".  Of course I had to try it because i love boba drinks!   
Honeydew tapioca:
I ordered the fresh honey dew with tapioca.  I was hoping it would taste like the one from sweetheart cafe in chinatown...but  it didn't. It didn't really have any taste (tasted like water). 
Strawberry/Banana tapioca:
My boyfriend got the strawberry/banana tapioca and this was really good!  I could taste the freshness of strawberries and bananas :)
Mango/Coconut:
Came back here a second time (The promotion really lures you in because without the promotion, fresh fruit drinks are at least double in price. The promotion is a definitely a deal and steal!!)
This drink is extremely heavy and thick.  I would not get this again.

*The promotion says "1.99 for all drinks" BUT note that the blueberry and durian drinks are at full price.
author: Roxana L.

description: Came here when they first opened back in 2012 and their boba was soft and fresh. Two years later and the boba still tastes delicious. Only gripe is that the milk tea doesn't have a strong flavor. Will be back though as its the perfect spot to grab a boba and hit the books across the street at Green Apple.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Just OK compared to the better boba places in the city like Sharetea and Super Cue. Their boba is chewy, but not sweet at all. So far, I've tried the taro and avocado. I'm not really a fan of the taro (taste was off and the texture was too thick for me), but the avocado was really good. They use real avocados so it's fresh! Not my favorite place, but I'll probably be back to get my boba fix when I'm too lazy to walk to Sharetea.

Also, does this place really have the same owner as Wonderful Foods? Hard to believe because this place uses CoffeeMate (yuck) while WF uses real milk.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Grand opening special $1.99 for their drinks! 

They make their drinks with fresh ingredients. None of that powdered crap. 

Service is quick and friendly although you can't tell where to order if there are a lot of people standing around. the Menu is next to the register, but it's off to the side from the register so it makes it a bit awkward to look at the menu. I actually stood in front of the menu and did not see the register since it was tiny. Welp, others (who either has been there before or who has better vision than I do) went directly to the register and ordered... basically cutting in line in front of me. Fortunately, the guy behind the registered asked me for my order since he noticed I was standing there with a confused look on my face. 

All in all... I would definitely be a regular here... at least during their $1.99 promotion. Their regular prices seems a bit high, but for the freshness of their drinks, I might splurge and still continue to get drinks from them.... we'll see how my budget holds up. hahaha....
author: Mei C.

description:
Stopped by this place on complete chance while the gf was looking for a place to relieve herself of excess waste water. Was carrying around a Schubert's cake from next door so out of guilt, I thought I should actually get something here. I got my usual plain order of a green tea milk tea with boba.

Order got fullfilled super quickly (it was less than a minute, holy crap) and out the door we went. Suprisingly good! Boba actually had the right consistency (pliant and chewy, not soggy or hard). Ice was small/crushed and so you get more drink while keeping the liquid cool. I'd go again.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Average boba. I was craving boba and this was the closest. The decor inside feels old and the lighting is none to very dim. It feels dark and scary. I was the only customer at the time so it felt even more scary. The cashier aka the boba maker was very nice and attentive though. She quickly acknowledged me. 

Their menu consisted of milk teas, smoothies, ice teas, and some snacks. I would probably say it's half the size of a Quicklys menu. Anyhow, I wasn't feeling too creative today so I just ordered their regular milk tea with boba. 

The boba itself wasn't anything special, no honey nor anything, but it was well cooked: soft and chewy. I noticed that they make the milk tea fresh and it isn't just pre-made or anything. I see them add quite a lot of ingredients into their "boba shaker aka margarita shaker." My milk tea took about 3-4 minutes to make. Overall, it was sweet to my liking. Definitely better than your typical boba chains out there. However, still average. Maybe next time I'll go give their flavored milk teas a try :)
author: Fiona L.

description:
This area has no parking. There's plenty of meters but they're always full. 
Ordered the Jasmine green milk tea and thought it was just ok. It didn't taste like jasmine really. I also thought it could've been slightly less sweet but more creamy. 

The boba wasn't bad.
Still on the hunt for really good jasmine green milk tea.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Im glad this place changed from the old Taiwanese boba place.  so much cleaner and more organized!
green bean boba=delicious! less sweet options also available.
boba were chewy and sweet.
author: Linda T.

description:
If you don't want to go all the way to Irving for your boba fix at Wonderful Foods Co, then come here because they're owned by the same people!

The place is definitely smaller than Wonderful Foods Co. But, they serve the same drinks and will soon be serving froyo! Anyway, I got a watermelon with tapioca and it was $2.99. It was refreshing and tasty as usual. No complaints about the tapioca pearls either. Legit!

Customer service is friendly here. But, since they were really busy, it took longer to get my drink. There is limited seating. Cash only! Come to Sweethut and support your local mom-and-pop store!
author: Fallon P.

description:
I always come here for the White Guard tea.
They make good almond milk tea too.

The only suggestion I have for them is to make their teas less sweet.. nobody likes a sugar-high 23 year-old shuflin' around the house.
author: Ximeng W.

description:
I've been coming to this boba place ever since it opened. The owner of this store is the same as Wonderful Foods on Irving in Sunset. The reason I love this place is that there are plenty of fresh fruit options for smoothies with boba and the prices are simply amazing. Where can you get a fresh fruit smoothie for $2.99? I haven't seen many without compromising quality. The fresh strawberry smoothie is amazing. Honeydew is a bit on the bland side, but that is how the fruit is. The watermelon tastes like a regular watermelon. The pearl milk tea here is pretty good, but sometimes when new employees get hired, it can be a miss. 

The owner of this place is simply amazing. I've seen him go out of his way and leave the store in order to purchase fresh fruits to satisfy a customer's order. Most people would simply say "sorry, we're out for today." 

There are a couple of small tables inside the store and there are window seats also. Too bad there isn't wifi here for people wanting to use their laptops. The "coming soon - frozen yogurt" sign has been there for ages. Doubt there will ever be any frozen yogurt, but their boba does really well, so why put some machines there and risk having malfunctions? 

The only down size of this place is that it is cash only.
author: Maybo L.

description:
I am in LOVE with Sweethut.

They make delicious smoothies and milk teas that are shaken, not stirred. That means that the milk tea is made right in front of you, poured into cocktail shakers, shaken, and poured out with just a bit of crushed ice. The flavor of the milk tea is strong (just the way I like it), although it could do with a little more tea flavor. It seems like the condensed milk kind of overpowers the tea flavor sometimes.

Their boba is also made to perfection. It's chewy, not too sweet, and just makes me feel like I'm in boba heaven.

Sweethut has specials going on right now: $1.99 for milk tea or green milk tea and $2.50 for various fruit smoothies (strawberry, strawberry banana, mango, watermelon, and papaya are the ones I remember, but there are a lot more). Just check out the blackboard outside of their shop for the complete list! And did I mention that these $1.99 and $2.50 prices INCLUDE boba? That's right. No extra $0.50 charge for the boba. It's all included in the price. Pretty sweet deal, if you ask me :)

So why four stars and not five? Because without these specials, the drinks themselves are kind of overpriced, in my opinion. Average of $3 or $4 for the cheapest drink, and then adding the price of toppings on top of that. I'll admit that the drinks are good, but I don't know if I'd be willing to pay regular price for them.
author: Yvonne K.

description:
I am happy to see there is a real boba tea shop in richmond

I tried the boba milk tea. and the staff made my order in front of me. It's pretty cool to see the process~ oh, the staff are cute guys too....

I wanted to try the "original" flavor so I didn't customize my order.. the drink was wayyyyyyy to sweet........the boba was a bit chewy but I liked it.  My sister ordered the almond milk tea: it's the combination of boba milk tea and almond jello. The flavor of almond was very light! I am thinking it's good because u don't drink a lot of MSG to create the flavor of almond~

Next time I may try their yogurt.
author: Sue S.

description:
Update: They ended their $1.99 special :(

Now it's $2.50 for their original milk tea with boba as well as green milk tea with boba. Although 50 cents isn't a lot, my boyfriend and I both come here around 5 times per week so for us it makes a difference. Still cheaper than most places though. 

Also, finally got to try their spicy calamari. Yum!
author: Heidi Q.

description:
Definitely one of the better boba places I've been too! Prices are good, service is good, and the consistency we received on the drinks has been great! I'm a simple man, and I just get the tapioca milk tea which is great! My daughter tried the taro milk tea, and I had a few sips and that was the best taro milk tea I've had so far! My son got his own too, and he finished his Thai milk tea with boba! My son hardly ever finishes his drinks, so he was banned from getting drinks for awhile. I let him slide this one time since we were out and about. 
Overall good place for boba! We love coming here when we are in the area!
author: Ron K.

description:
There is no fragrance to their oolong milk teas. Tasted bland like sweetened milk. Their lychee milk tea tastes artificial. Tried them out twice and both times their teas just doesnt taste right.

Go down the street to Little Sweet or Sharetea to taste the difference
author: Crystal R.

description:
The milk tea here is really good if you like stronger tea!  Prices are fair and staff is very friendly.  

PRICING:  A
$1.99 for a milk tea with tapioca.

SERVICE:  A
Friendly servers who make your drink on the spot and are ok with customizing your orders.

DRINKS:  A
Milk tea here is very strong, with the right amount of sweetness.  I love their milk tea!

BOBA:  B
Good texture and firmness, but kinda tasteless.  They also give a lot of boba.
author: Tim L.

description: The drinks are no longer much cheaper than their Wonderful Foods counterpart and the taste/quality is not the same. With all the other competition these days, I'm disappointed in them. Will no longer be coming he
author: S L.

description:
For some reason, whenever I come to SF, my friend always takes me here. I tried a couple of sips of the watermelon boba before and that was really fresh tasting. However, a couple of days ago, I tried the taro milk tea boba and it was just "aite". I mean, I felt really full from drinking just half of it and it felt like an overload of sugar. Despite this, props to Sweethut for blending the ice into little bitty chunks so that you get more for what you paid for. They are also extremely generous with their boba which were just the right amount of chewy. I would come again, but not for taro. 

The funny thing was Jerry Springer was playing on the flat screen and a bunch of high schoolers started chanting, "JERRY! JERRY! JERRY!". Good times.
author: Eva L.

description:
I've only ever ordered the milk tea with boba...it's my fav and I find the other flavors just way too sweet.

The folks behind the counter are usually pleasant, and the prices are reasonable.  My curiosity is always around the strangeness of the counter. Did they at one time offer a 'make your own' boba bar, then shut it down when people got too greedy? 

I'll continue to ponder this mystery of life just as I will continue to order the regular milk tea boba.
author: Christy L.

description:
I was glad to know that this place is owned by the same Wonderful Foods owner.  I was more glad that they were having a 1.99 special because I get to try those more expensive drinks at a lower price.
The first time I came here I ordered the mango coconut smoothie with tapioca.  I was pretty disappointed that it didn't have any coconut at all, but I figured they just opened.  Hubby's avocado smoothie was good.  Tapioca is also chewy yummy.  My second time I ordered the bean drink and hubby ordered thai iced tea.  Strong and yummy.  
I'm glad there's boba place around the area other than Quickly and other mediocre places.  Oh yea this place looks different from the previous boba place that occupied this location.  More welcoming.  Hopefully they can keep it up.
author: Claire J.

description:
Came here today after an excursion to Q and Cherry Blossom Bakery, because I had a severe craving for milk tea. My rule of thumb: even though there's a Quickly right there, give it a block or two. If you can't find any other places that serve milk tea, fine, fine, go to Quickly. Thankfully, Sweethut was pretty much just a couple of doors down, and I like heading to a new milk tea place.

Like many places, this is cash-only, so be sure you've got at least $3 in your pocket. Since I usually opt for honey black tea and that wasn't on the menu, I decided to try the wulong milk tea, which I have never had before.

I felt like a fool for being blind to it for so long. The milk tea was perfectly sweetened. I'm not a fan of boba, but they had a huge list of boba flavors - so hooray for the folks who like that! I go to milk tea places for the tea...and this was absolutely excellent. Super light and refreshing, and my boyfriend even enjoyed it, which is rare considering our sweetness tolerance is very different. When I'm in the area again, I will definitely come back.
author: Robbin A.

description:
Typically I buy boba at Quickly(they're very popular).  But recently we stopped at Sweethut.  OMG!?!?!?!?  The price, quality, and authenticity is WAY better than Quickly.  
The price of 2 drinks at Sweethut=1 at Quickly.  Analyzing cost & value makes this place supersede big chains like Quickly.  Afterall, why pay for for 1 when you can get 2?
author: Smoking D.

description:
Name: Sweethut
My Complaint: ...drinks are too sweet

o_O
O_o

I've tasted a total of 6 drinks from here and they were all too sweet.
I feel really bad that I'm somewhat holding it against them.. 
perhaps I just need to stop coming on Saturday afternoons
when there is a line of 50 azns that has been attracted by the $1.99 sign.
The place is really cute, so I will give them a few months to get their Froyo on,
before coming back for more boba.
author: Jade T.

description: Looking at the ratings, i didn't really expect it to be GREAT but now, when i finally try it, the tea it pretty good(if you like strong tea). The fresh fruit drinks are pretty good to, depending if its in season. The service was ok, but the drinks came pretty quick and i was surprised. The prices are about right for boba nowadays. I would come here again.
author: Ally G.

description:
After going to baker's beach, went here to get a hot milk tea with tapioca. $2.84 for their 16 oz milk tea! I think that's a reasonable price. 

Their tapioca balls were good, better than quickly's or any other chain boba place. But the milk tea wasn't sweet enough for me and my sweet tooth. Too many new boba places in the Richmond/sunset now, I'm sticking to Wonderful Foods on Irving and 22nd - it's always made wonderful boba drinks.
author: Kayla O.

description:
I dropped in before the grand opening sale was over. I got the green tea milk tea with tapioca. 

The ordering line system was a bit confusing even though I was the only customer that night. The serving size and the amount of tapioca is very generous for their $1.99 sale. I actually got annoyed with the tapioca because there was so much! Overall, I was only okay with my drink. It's probably because the taste was too bitter for me.

I wonder when they're going to open the frozen yogurt section of the store. At least I think that's what they're going to sell since the machines looks like they're already assembled.
author: Jess W.

description:
Loud. Its really loud in here.

No wonder there was a line out the door yesterday, it was the last day of the $1.99 special. Bummer. 

I will be back on occasion because it is good and the people friendly.
author: Justin S.

description:
This place seems fairly new. Don't recall it being here for long. 

In any case, great boba place. Boba was fresh. The juices were created with care. The staff was chill and friendly.  The place is clean, and basic. There's no gimmic like the purple cow. You get good stuff here. Also, there's other options besides boba. Plenty of other squishy and slippery goodness to put in your drink.
author: Boris C.

description: Modern boba shop in the Richmond district that has enough tables and seats for the crowd. I'm a firm believer of Wonderful Foods in Irving and we came here after hearing their owner opened another shop. I'm a big fan of their almond jelly milk tea, oolong milk tea, and jasmine milk tea. I remember their grand opening when everything was $1.99! Good times!
author: Yumi H.

description:
Visits: 1st
Rating: 3*
Service: Excellent

Boba tea that's good enough to hit the spot. Got Almond Milk Tea, half milk, half sweet. Don't live in the area but wifey had a big craving & found this place on yelp. We're not the type to pass up a place just because they don't have 5*. Long story short, craving tamed, wife is happy. Like the saying goes, happy wife, happy rest of the day. Err, yeah.
author: Daniel T.

description: This place really sucks and even one star for them is too high of rating.  As long as they don't remove that grand opening sign with $1.99 discount words then I would believe its intentionally cheating on customers.  I'll definitely want to report this to the Better Business Bureau.
author: Peter S.

description:
This boba place was never good, but it's location near my apartment made me come here in times of desperation... a total of three times. The first time, I ordered the original milk tea with boba and I distinctly remember how watery it tasted. It was just milk with tea. The tea had no character and the milk/cream had none either. 

Going to Sweet Hut yesterday, I see how dangerous it is in terms of going out of business. The lights are dimmed, the collections of colorful jellys and such are no longer brightly displayed in the front. They still have the grand opening banner in the front of the shop, from 2012, and they still don't have a proper sign. When I ordered my milk tea, it seemed like it was pre-made as they poured it out from the cocktail mixer... who knows how long it had been sitting there.

And again.. the drink was terrible. I never thought I'd say this, but I rather go to the Quickly a few blocks down, Sweet hut is that bad.
author: Lars B.

description:
Been here enough times to say that their drinks are consistently decent and good enough to keep coming. Their milk green tea with boba is $1.99 on their "Specials" board- my fav! 

Inside is pretty small, but clean and simple. Never crowded when I'm there for work around 3-4 on weekdays. Yay for no long lines (ahem...Purple Kow). A few bar seats and tables to sit and chat. Their menu displays a wide array of drinks and smoothies, but at pretty hefty prices $2.50-$4 depending. I think that's "expensive", but I guess I've been spoiled by $1 boba places. They also have the usual boba shop snacks: fried this and fried that. Also Tea Eggs for $1!

Service is also pretty nice, so I will definitely keep coming when I'm around 6th Ave and need a boba-fix!
author: Eva H.

description:
They have a great variety of teas and flavors. Had thud honey green tea with boba, hot which I have to say is better than the cold lychee green tea with boba - it comes with bits of lychee in it which was unexpected. 
Overall though, satisfies a boba craving :)
author: Van-Anh N.

description:
Milk tea is more or less the same everywhere you go.  What sets this place apart from others is the great service.  The numerous options are perplexing enough at these boba places, but to ask a question only to have someone stare at your blankly is annoying and quite frankly, will not help keep the line moving.  The several times I've been to Sweethut, the folks have been nice in recommending drinks according to what I've been craving.  Today, one of the guys there even suggested against ordering some drink with sesame in it because their new vendor gave them a product that doesn't taste great.  I'm sure most places would have kept quiet and just let you order, pay for it, and hate it.

My orders there have included regular milk tea, wulong milk tea and their thai milk tea.  Tapioca balls are chewy and not overly soaked (I hate mushy balls!)  Price is great, service is great and drinks are satisfying.
author: Heidi L.

description:
There's a nice selection of stuff here - feels less Americanized than most boba places. Also some funny flavor combinations that could be really good (strabwerry + green tea!)

Prices are quite cheap, but service was slow. Cash only.
author: Conrad B.

description: This is my favorite place in the city for boba with real fruit because it always tastes so fresh. Same owners as Wonderful's on sunset and employees are always so nice.   I highly suggest trying their strawberry banana smoothie tapioca, it's bomb.
author: Emily W.

description: In my opinion, it's the modern version of Wonderfuls. Ifs good, but the boba is lacking flavor
author: Jefferey L.

description: I was very impressed with their coffee milk tea. It was a great balance amongst the flavors of coffee + milk + tea. Usually this combination can just taste like bad coffee with boba. The regular milk tea is also good. The drinks are made right behind the counter and you can see the lady putting all the mixins together in her shaker (at least I did). The boba isn't the best consistency I've had and actually was more on the starchy side than sweet. Sweethut is bright and clean and I'd return if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Maya S.

description: I was here about 2 months ago, and sadly, all I remember is that my drink was very bland and didn't finish it. Anytime you can't finish a boba drink, it means that it's not tasty and not worth the calories. You should probably just drink water instead. It was in the middle of regular business hours when I came and some of the chairs were still stacked. It just made me feel like this place is not welcoming, meaning it's probably disorganized, meaning the product is probably not good. Not to give myself expectations from that first impressions, but dang I pretty much wasted some measly dollars on a not-good boba drink. With all this said, I don't recommend coming here. Let the high schoolers and people who don't know better go here while you find somewhere better.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Everywhere I go, it's usually a honey green tea or milk tea with grass jelly -  so not too exciting but hard to go wrong either. 

Sweethut is pretty good and never too busy and so far, all my visits have been no more than five minutes in and out. The tea could be a bit stronger, but maybe that's just me? Just took off a star since it's relatively pricey compared to what I usually pay. My large honey green tea with grass jelly is $4.75 - so for the noobs out there, it's about $1 more than usual. Nonetheless, still wouldn't mind stopping by if I'm in the area. 

The drinks are good and the store is clean. There are a couple of tables/chairs if you want to sit and chill for a bit, or if you need a break from grocery shopping along Clement?
author: Ellen N.

description: Anticipated a great experience here. I've been meaning to go here for months.  On one of my recent trips to San Francisco I dragged my daughter away from the book store across the street.  Upon arriving we came to face a confusing board of items to order from.  There we stood looking over the board while the clerk decided to continue  his conversation with a costumer for another ten minutes.  Yes, she had already ordered. As we wanted I watched three more set of patrons come in and decided to leave. My daughter decided on one of their special flavor so there I waited.  Finally the lady received her order and off she went.  The reluctant clerk took our order and past it on to the girls that were making the drink.  He rushed after the lady that just left. While we waited two more people came in and left seeing no one to take their order. When my order came and I took a sip of it my daughter started laughing at the face I pulled.  Disgustingly sour Strawberry drink.  My daughter had boba added to hers.  I couldn't even chew them. Again my daughter was set in fits laughing at me.  None of the three drinks I ordered were any good.
author: China Doll B.

description: I was craving a tapioca drink the other day and decided to try this place as it was near by. I decided to try a papaya shake with boba which was priced at about $4. I think considering the many boba places in the city (let alone in the neighborhood) they would have some interesting spin on thier take, however, to my disappointment, the papaya was neither ripe nor did they bother to add enough milk. Apparently, thier touted being the "sister" store of Wonderful Foods in the sunset, however, in my opinion, they just don't compare. The boba was just OK for me and I still prefer going to T-pumps, Wonderful foods or Infinity
author: Petra S.

description:
This is the sister location of Wonderful Foods on Irving. They are having a $1.99 special on their boba milk tea. I believe it's $2.75 at Wonderful Foods, so you can save a whole $.76 right now by making the trip out to Sweethut! However, once the special is over, Wonderful Foods might be cheaper. Parking can be difficult but it's worth stopping by if you're in the area. Red A Bakery is also across the street so you can pair your milk tea with some chicken katsu.

Tell them Allan sent you. They don't know who I am, so telling them I sent you will probably just confuse them.

My tummy gives Sweethut...4 Stars!
author: Allan L.

description:
I found this place on accident while finishing up some grocery shopping at May Wah (love that place btw). Ever since then, I've continued to "accidentally" find myself here whenever I run errands in the area.

They have a huge drink menu, which also includes some snacks as well. The place is rather small - a couple of high tables with chairs, so it's more of an in-and-out place if you're coming in with a group. I like the bright and modern decorations that they have - it's a nice sight from the old china town market feel. The staff are sociable and willing to accommodate your taste preferences.

Best part of all is that the prices are cheaper compared to other boba places ($1.99 for milk tea) AND it's perfect! I love the consistent quality.

Note: CASH ONLY. So bring some with you, get your boba fix, and enjoy!
author: Loriel L.

description: This place was empty, which meant no line! The service was great and the girl behind the counter was so friendly. Tasty Boba too.
author: Ben Z.

description:
Sweethut is owned by Wonderful Foods Co. in the Sunset, so I expected an awesome Strawberry smoothie with boba and I was right! 

Drink menu has a huge variety, but I like to stick with the smoothies since that's my territory. If I don't want boba, the hot Almond milk tea is good here too. 

Drinks are cheaper than other boba places I've been to, so I'm all for the student affordable boba. Can't go wrong with the boba here since the consistency is excellent. 

The only thing I don't like by this area of town is that PARKING SUCKS! 

That's about it.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
I really enjoy this boba tea joint, it is tied for my favorite in SF (with Wonderful Foods Co). So much better than Quickly! There is a good selection of teas and flavors, and they offer fresh fruit juices and smoothies with boba too (haven't tried these yet, but have seen customers get fresh watermelon juice that looks great). The tapioca has a good consistency and mild flavor, personally I think the amount they put in is just right.

So far my favorites I've tried - Milk Black, Milk Green, Wu-Long Tea, and Winter Melon tea. My BF has gotten mocha, coffee, and chocolate flavors and those have been rich and tasty.
