I have tried a few others I haven't liked as much - Sesame (was a bit gritty) and Yogurt (a bit too sour). I also LOVE that you can request they make it less sweet - often times my main complaint with boba drinks is that they are too sugary. I know they are supposed to be sweet but I appreciate that there are options here.

Decor is clean, bright, cheery, but I rarely see anyone sitting/hanging out in here. As others have said it seems like more of a to-go place, which is fine. Employees are friendly and give good service. Prices standard for boba, start at $2.50 (for basic tea) and range up to $5-ish for the juice/smoothie drinks.

 Yay for Sweet Hut!
author: Remi X.

description: Great milk tea - not watered down, not too sweet, & great depth of tea flavor.  Very friendly and prompt service.
author: Sheila C.

description:
I was not to far away and I Yelped for a tapioca drink place and noticed that Sweethut wasn't too far where I was.  So, why not try it?!  

This is a cute small place with bar stools and small tables along the wall enough for people to enjoy their drink and converse or read a book.  The place itself was very clean from what I can see.  The service was fast, nothing bad about it.

Luckily, when I walked in there was not a line and was able to order right away.  I didn't order anything fancy, but a regular milk tea without boba.  I'd have to say I've had better tasting milk teas and I don't know if this one was just not sweet enough for my liking, but I could have probably asked to make it sweeter.  

I plan to come back again and try something else and add boba....then maybe my 3 star can bump up to a 4 or 5.  I guess I just need a drink to give me that wow factor.
author: Caroline A.

description:
Pretty disappointing. I had the Milk Green Tea with Tapioca. The milk green tea was rather bland and watered down and the tapioca was way too overcooked so it was super mushy and soft. They were generous with tapioca though for all those boba lovers out there. I do like their varieties of teas, milk teas, and fresh fruit drinks though such as papaya, strawberry and watermelon. Perhaps I'll give those a try next time! 

Con: Cash Only
author: Shanna C.

description: I think I'm boba-ed out this weekend. Had too much boba for the weekend. Walked around this area... and yes! Total boba place! Boba!! Boba!!! Got a regular Milky-Black-Tea with Tapioca Pearl Drink for $2.0 ... and delish! Delish here I come! 4 stars!
author: Mindy Y.

description: Sweethut is a good find on Clement street in San Francisco. I noticed it with the huge grand opening banner still hanging from the entrance. It is in the midst of many asian supermarkets and good to sit down after too much grocery shopping. (Or while you wait for your parents/grandparents to buy groceries, haha) There was only one person while I went to the shop but she was working hard and trying to turnover the customers as fast as she could. I got the Litchi tapioca milk tea for $2.99 and it was pretty authentic. What set this apart was that they use real lychee bits that float to the top of the drink that gives the flavor a twist, rather than just powder. The boba texture was pretty consistent and chewy.
author: Jordan W.

description: I was in the neighborhood and decided to stop by sweet hut, it was my first time here and I ordered a Thai Tea and Strawberry Black Tea. The strawberry black tea had a super strong taste, but the sweetness was perfect. The Thai Tea was perfect but, I perfer mine a tad bit sweeter.
author: A'Niya M.

description:
An aspiring boba spot that still has room to grow. The lady taking our order had a difficult enough time scribbling orders onto cups and taking money. Definitely new to the business.

Boba texture was surprisingly spot on. Where they slacked is the tea. Very watery and sugary. Harder to tell with the flavored drinks but very obvious in the original milk or green tea.

Give some time for this one to mature a bit.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I really like this boba place! There are a lot of drinks to choose from, there is fast and friendly service, you get a lot of boba, and the boba is perfectly chewy! The price is pretty good, too.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Review #1255. Happy boba tea here. Both black sesame and barley were good as they were not too sweet.

Service was nice as they were about to close and we quickly got the post dinner drinks to go.
author: T L.

description:
Generous portions on the jelly and boba. Friendly service. 

This is a great place to wait while you're waiting to eat at Burma Superstar. ;)

Be careful not to get carried away with the add-ons. It can get tempting to ruin your drink.
author: Jordan H.

description: Same quality as Wonderful Foods but for slightly less. Welcomed addition to Richmond district.
author: Jude N.

description: This is a carbon copy of Wonderful Foods Co. on Irving. It's owned by the same people! I was actually hoping to try something new on Clement but I realized it's just exactly the same as Wonderful's. Although that was disappointing, the drinks are good as usual (I'm a fan of Wonderful's). I got an oolong milk tea w/ tapioca and it tasted just the same as the one on Irving. The BF got a watermelon juice which was fresh and good on a warm sunny day.
author: Mary X.

description:
The new "Wonderful Foods Co" #2 is still a work in progress, as the froyo machines aren't in yet.  OH WELL, I guess they'll have to just keep offering the $1.99 Grand Opening Special for longer than the posted 6-15-12!  YAY!

The #18 Wulong Milk Tea has a more distinct tea flavor, which I liked over the standard milk tea.   The sweetness reminded me of honey, and even with the stronger tea, it was still a bit milky for my tastes.
author: Kevin W.

description: Ordered an almond milk tea and it was just OK. It didn't taste like an almond milk tea and could be due to the half and half used (read it in another review). I doubt I'll be back especially with the competition in the area. I really wanted to like this place too.  :(
author: Sarah B.

description:
Went here after wandering around the Richmond today.  We saw the sign that said all drinks were $1.99 until June 15 and in we went.  Be ready to be overwhelmed with the various choices all posted up on the bill board.  Went with a Lychee tapioca milk tea and a fresh pineapple with pineapple jells.  Both were really good and refreshing.

The tapioca balls were nice and fresh.  Just the right amount of bounce a good tapioca ball should have...=)  Love the fact that the owners from Wonderful Foods opened this place since they have been pretty consistent all these years with the flavor of their teas and the chewiness of their t-balls.  

Beware that some of their drink prices will be kind of steep once the promotion is over...Bracing myself but will be enjoying the discount until then...
author: Cris H.

description: Great place for tapioca drink far better than the copycats on clement street.  One suggestion to the owner is the guy you hire gotta make the drinks faster....
author: William C.

description:
I don't understand any of the positive reviews.

I ordered a strawberry green tea, which should be green tea flavored w/ strawberry. What I got was a pepto bismol looking and tasting drink. And their "tea" came out of a juice or milk carton thing. It tasted terrrible! They told me afterwards it was powder. I wish they had a sign explicitly stating that so I wouldn't have ordered it...

Please don't come here and waste your money on substandard sweets.
author: Nona T.

description:
Met the owner, owner of Wonderful Foods. No more driving over to Sunset for a cup. Score. Bigger score, $1.99 Grand Opening deal til June 15. Looove it.

Can't wait til they get their Froyo machines installed. Can't wait!
author: Jeannie L.

description: Large milk tea and juice selection. Friendly staff.
author: Eugene M.

description:
Two things: 

1) Fresh Juice - Mango Coconut. So delicious and so fresh! They are very generous with the portion of mangos. 

2) Drinks are $1.99 until 6/15/12. 

Will definitely keep coming back! (:
author: Philana C.

description: Sweethut lives up to it's name. It's soo sweet. I've been to Sweethut twice already, and both times, it was too sweet for my liking, I'm not sure why I went back the second time.
author: Stacy C.

description:
Sweet Hut, what would I do without you? 

Anyone that feels the urge to get a fruit smoothie in the Inner Richmond should go to Sweet Hut, there are no replacements. I'm dating a girl that was raised in SF and she's pretty picky about her Boba. Sweet Hut is only ONE of the three places where she'll even consider going for milk tea and smoothies in the City. They're definitely doing it right. 

The employees at Sweet Hut are friendly, attentive and very accommodating. My orders are almost always complicated but they always get it right. I'll take a strawberry smoothie, less sweet, half boba with less milk. They'll respond with a nod and then write down your order with a smile. They use real fruit and only charge $2.50 for most smoothies ($2.99 for strawberry and avocado) it's the best deal you can get around there, I just wish they were located in the Outer Richmond so I could walk to them from my house.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Out with the old boba place and in with the new. I am a fan of wonderful foods, I like the creaminess of the milk tea and use of real fruits - not powder. I walked by and noticed the Grand Opening sign with $1.99 for all drinks until 6/15/12. I had my usual Papaya Milk Tea and they haven't gotten the mix right. The boba balls were chewy and a good texture but the drink itself was bland because they added too much ice and not nough sugar. The young kids working there are new so the drinks still need perfecting. The owner can make the perfect boba drink with his eyes closed, but was there to supervise and train. I would give it awhile before going back, I'm sure the fro-yo will draw crowds on sunny days. 

I like the interior, modern design and beautiful orchids everywhere. I sat for a bit on the tall chairs and relaxed.
author: Candace F.

description:
Word around the block: Sweethut is the younger sister store of Wonderful Foods in the Sunset. I liked Wonderful's tapioca so I had to give this place a try..

Plus, the tapioca drinks are well priced from $2-3 and up to $5 if you want real fruit (avocados, and such things)

they dont have a candy bar here like at wonderful foods.

Their tapioca balls were a good chewy and sweet and the drink was good.
Located in between the lively streets of Clement, near 6th so its perfect to grab and go get groceries or other good asian desserts!

CASH ONLY
author: Tiffany N.

description:
According to all the hullabaloo this place is suppose to be the progeny of Wonderful's Food Co. on Irving.
Their strawberry smoothie was definitely on par with Wonderful's, but delightfully $1.50 cheaper than their Irving counterpart.
Definitely worth checking out while they have their grand opening promotional prices of $1.99  milk teas and $2.50 fruit smoothies, but we'll see how their prices rise after their promotions.
Boba is great. Texture, consistency all really good.
They were originally suppose to be self-serve fro-yo place, so hopefully they'll get their machines soon!
author: Jenna H.

description:
I'm going to say it: This is the freshest, most delicious bubble tea I have EVER tasted.

In contrast to a chain-that-shan't-be-named just a few blocks west, these guys mix fresh fruit with your tea and milk of choice (dairy or non-dairy), and blend it up right in front of your eyes. No questionable syrup containers, no unknown ingredients, no suspicious powders; just a delicious fresh beverage.

As a service to you, here is how to read their versatile yet somewhat unorthodoxly presented menu. I happened to stroll in off-peak, and the charming young lady behind the counter enthusiastically shared the following with me:

Tea section: Means what you think it means. Your favorite type of tea plus fruit plus milk (you have a choice here between whole milk, half-and-half, as well as soy milk, which means that you can have vegan drinks too!)

Flavor section: The ingredients listed in this area are blended up with Coffee Mate. And when they say "flavor" what they mean is actual fresh fruit, down to fresh taro.

Juice section: This basically lists what I would call "smoothies". I had the mango-coconut, and it was incredibly delicious.

Slushie(?): I can't remember what this section was called exactly, but that part is self-explanatory.

They also have a small selection of fried foods which I have not personally tried.

It's also worth pointing out once more that your drink is entirely customizable and can be made VEGAN.

To those of you already decrying the "terrible customer service": Waah waah waah. Yes, this place gets busy during weekend afternoons, especially due to the $1.99 promotion, and yes, maybe they need better (or any at all) signage that tells you where exactly you are supposed to form a line, but these guys are working hard, and fresh fruit blended beverages just take a little extra time. 

They also sell you an experience: They are the Starbucks of bubble tea if you will, with their neatly displayed fruit containers and clean and open preparation area. If instead you're looking for impersonal, quick-and-dirty artificial beverages, and some greasy old couches to sit on, I have just the chain store for you. It's a few blocks to you left.
author: C D.

description:
My sister ordered two bubble milk teas, one for me, one for her.
We weren't expecting the tea to taste like coffee. When we went back to ask about it, they were adamant that was how 'black tea tastes like' and claimed it was because their tea was darker, and basically said I just needed to add sugar to it. ???
The reason it gets stars is because it tastes good. The tapioca was soft, and the 'tea' tasted good. The only problem was that, I wasn't expecting coffee-flavored tapioca drink. My sister said, "If I wanted coffee boba, I would've gotten one." We know how black tea is supposed to taste, we've made tapioca milk tea before and we've had a lot in different states, and they tasted like black tea. Not coffee.
Thee stars off because they didn't handle my complaint well. They basically said I didn't know how milk tea tasted like, and didn't really handle my problem. Instead I left with the same two teas I came in to complain about. Overall, service sucks.
I wouldn't exactly go again, because I personally don't like tea that way. However if you like their coffee and tapioca, it's pretty good.
author: MaryAnn H.

description:
I personally like this place a lot. Great customer service and more importantly I like their tapioca pearl, chewy and tasty. I tried most of drinks and I satisfied my cravings of tapioca drink. 

Everyone taste bud is different and I don't like drink that is too sweet. You can ask how sweet you need in your drink.

Give it a try:)
author: Nixon A.

description:
It just what clement needs, another boba place, other than Quickly.

The boba drinks are alright. However, are not worth their price. I had pay around $5 for a large Thai Tea. It really didn't  taste that good. It was more bitter than sweet. Ya, it's okay.
author: M L.

description: The bubble tea was decent though it would be nice I'd they mixed it. No WiFi, but can access from other shops in the area. Quite and low key ambiance. Not a bad quick treat
author: Marcus T.

description: Good selection of drinks and nice staff.  I've had the red bean and taro so far.  The red bean is literally blended red beans, so I don't think I'll order that again because it was hard to drink.  But the taro was delicious!
author: Vira P.

description:
After eating at PPQ, my group started craving for more boba, especially after having some at Honey B. We wanted to find another good boba place to try out, so we exolored more of  Clement.

According to the reviews, we decided to walk to this place. I ordered the pudding milk tea and my goodness was it the most disappointing drink i have ever had. My friend got the honey green tea and after a sip he threw it away said it wasnt worth it.

Maybe it could have been that day I went which might have affected the experience, or it could be normal thats why I give it a 3. Hope next time I go it will be better.
author: Marvin L.

description: this is probably the worst bubble tea I had ever had. the taste is absolutely disgusting. I ordered peach black tea with boba. It was super sweet and it didn't even taste like tea or peach. will never go back to this shitty place.
author: Rea M.

description:
We ordered the almond milk tea, but it was a little confusing when we ordered. I think we ended up ordering milk made with almond milk instead of almond flavored milk tea.

The tea had a strange flavor, but the boba was good...chewy, but not too soft. 

With all the boba places around SF, I probably won't be back.
author: Annaliese D.

description:
Came in today after work to check out what replaced the old spot. 

I used to come here as a kid to get their tapioca drinks, along with some snacks here and there. I called it the purple place. Business was doing really well back then, so I wonder what happened. If someone has the 411, let me know!

All their drinks are on special for $1.99 (regular $2.99-$4.25 for most, except for the durian drink) until mid June for their grand opening, so there was a small line, and a continuous flow of people. Aside from myself, I didn't see anyone else come in for just "one drink". Everyone left with like 3 or 4; I'm assuming because of the promotion going on. The wait took forever! But I can't complain, because the waits are where the deals are. 

Where they made the drinks was a pretty open space. I like that because you get to see what goes in your drink, and the cleanliness. I saw a bunch of fresh mangos go in one drink, and it seemed like they were more than generous with their ingredients. 

I ordered the fresh taro milk tapioca, which was good. Next time, I might opt for something a little more generic and sweet :)

Will be back!

CASH ONLY!
author: Elaine H.

description:
fresh taro

this place is the sister store of the place on irving, minus the sweet and salty snacks
author: Long C.

description:
When we first came in my hubby bought a taro slushie with bobas. He didn't like the fact that there was too much boba. I got a milk tea with almond pudding he charged me 50cents for that but whatever the drink itself was like 1.99 plus .50 cents.

The next time we came back we ordered a taro slushi I was still1.99 but this time they took forever and they nevered call us to tell us we just had to ask.the taro slishie was WHITE so we told them it wasn't it. They made another one and told us to keep the white slushi but it tasted nasty.. So they don't have a system for drinks 2 stars off but taro slushi deserves 3 star and it was cheap so w.e
author: Victoria T.

description: Ordered the Fresh Honeydew Tapioca. Quenched my thirst with the fresh drink and satisfied my boba needs. I recommend them for your milk tea and boba cravings.
author: Emily L.

description:
If I was closer, this would become by go-to boba place for several reasons:

Good, chewy consistency on the boba. 
Friendly and prompt service that is also very knowledgeable and handy with suggestions and alternatives.  
Plenty of options, as expected of a bubble tea house.
Great tasting fruit juice alternatives.
The biggest and most surprising factor: the tea. I had a Mint Green Tea w/tapioca. The first drink I've had in a while that could legitimately call itself a TEA drink. No, not a tea-flavored drink (I question the amount of tea in these drinks sometimes); an actual flavored TEA drink! The tea was strong and the flavoring good! I'll be back.

PS, CASH only!
author: Emmeline A.

description: Came here because we saw the grand opening sign. The boba milk tea wasn't bad but it wasn't memorable either.
author: Betty C.

description: Could not even finish my drink. Wulong (oolong) milk tea with tapioca that were flavorless and tasted like rubber. Inner Richmond really needs a better bubble tea joint.
author: Dora L.

description:
This is my Richmond go-to boba shop! They've been around for about a year and have continued to sell their product at the promotional rate of $1.99. Price is comparable to the other tea shops in the area, but they def beat the competition in terms of flavor. They seem to be using a pretty good quality black tea for their milk tea. The flavor is really present....not that watered down, bland stuff they're slinging at Quickly. I highly recommend checking them out. Staff is pretty friendly and the service is always quick. 

Be sure to try the Milk Tea, you will not be disappointed!
author: Brandon J.

description: Horrible boba, boba was hard and drink was too sweet for my taste. Tea did not taste freshly brew.
author: Happi Y.

description:
Live in the greater richmond area? too lazy to drive to irving? SWEETHUT IS THE ANSWER! 

same great service, drinks, plus more all at a lower price til june 15. Even without the great promo price they have going on, they're STILL serving up the best tapioca in town with wonderful foods
author: Kenny L.

description: Great drinks and reasonable prices but the service was slow. We ordered 5 drinks and the last one was finally available when the first one was nearly completely consumed. Maybe they need more machines and/or staff?
author: Hannah P.

description:
Heard about this place from a friend who told me they just opened and is currently doing a promotion where all drink are only $1.99! 

Exteriorly, I didn't like their logo/store sign "Sweethut" at all. With all the different colored letters- it looked tacky and fruity....especially that hut image. 

BUT when I walked in, I actually liked the interior design and colorful walls of the place. 

I ordered the Green Milk tea, hoping the green tea will be a remedy for mild hangovers and boy it was DELICIOUS! did it help with the hangover?...maybe a bit..but it was so good, I temporarily forgot about the pounding headache. 

Will definitely be back to try some of their other drinks if I'm ever in the area!

if you want to get their drink for only $1.99 - better hurry cause it won't be 1.99 after June 15!!
author: Eileen Z.

description: My favorite bubble tea place in SF! They have almond jello! Try the strawberry milk with almond jello.
author: Alice H.

description:
Fast service and cheap. Got the Jasmine boba tea. A bit too sweet near the boba, I think the syrup must have settled around the boba. Tea was decent. Only $1.99 for a cup!

Seems like they will also in the future have froyo.
author: Michael W.

description:
Being a loyal customer of Wonderful Foods in the Sunset, I knew I had to stop by! Though I didn't catch the grand opening special where the drinks were super cheap and all of that, it is still quality tapioca. 

The owners and workers travel between stores which is pretty cool. Haha. 

The taste is just like Wonderful. It makes going to the Richmond a little more bare able since now I won't have to make a stop at Irving just for yummy boba. 

They have a huge selection of drinks and snacks and I believe they are going to start froyo in the futureeee! 

Clement hasn't really had great tapioca since Sweet Delight closed so I'm soooo glad!
author: Susan Y.

description:
Walked by and saw a grand opening special of $1.99 until 6/15/12. That totally caught my attention and before I know it, I was inside and ordering a drink.

This place looks like a work in progress literally. There's an area for froyo machines that do not exist. The front counter has what looks like a self service toppings for the drinks, but there's none. There didn't seem to be really any place to sit down on the inside except for about three tables. Did they hurry and open the place? Either they are going to put these in or they just didn't remodel the place.

The drinks come made the way they are described. My milk tea tasted alright to me. It didn't have a great impact to me. However, the tapopica balls were fresh and chewy.  I'll give this place another shot once a few weeks alter.
author: Steven B.

description:
$1.99 till June 15! Heck yeah!

I got the green milk tea ($2.50 after June 15) and it was good. Not too sweet and you can taste the tea. I would come back again before the deal ends.
author: Erica T.

description: Good milk tea here and above average, hit the spot after a long walk. The basil popcorn chicken was fine although a little strangely sweet.  Fun, bright, modern atmosphere...good place for two folks to hang out.
author: Philip L.

description: The passion fruit green tea here is tasty and not overly sweet. The popcorn chicken is also a must with the boba drink. I see that they have yogurt machines but there was no yogurt.
author: Jennie W.

description: This is a cute little boba tea place not to mention it's in the area where you have accesses  to restaurant, super markets and food to go within in distance of walks. The staff was friendly & helpful. They kept their menu pretty simple and not overly big which they have from teas, flavors, smoothies and snacks. Definitely coming back when I get the chance to be back in town!
author: Nana S.

description:
Definitely a standard run of the mill bubble tea joint.  Not bad, the pearls were a little too sweet, and I found it interesting that my tea was poured out of a plastic gallon-jug (a bit weird, but I guess when my tea is usually ladled out of the huge buckets, there's not much difference).  

The more I think about it, though, the sweeter the pearls get.  It was actually a little difficult for me to finish my drink after I ordered it, and I always finish my tea (if not always my pearls).

When I went, last month, they had the installations open and waiting for Fro-Yo machines, so probably something to look forward too!  I'll definitely be stopping by again in the future, see if  I can get them to ease up a bit in the sweetness (pearls were great in texture, just a bit cloying).
author: Emilynne A.

description:
Brought to you by Wonderful Foods located on Irving St, except Sweet Hut looks more polished and hip. Their $1.99 grand opening special was enjoyable and I'm upset I didn't take advantage of it more. They're regular priced drinks are about ~$3. At least now the line doesn't come out past the door...

I came here when it first opened so the employees were still a bit nervous and uncomfortable. What made it even more awkward is that the girl who took my order had a hard time understanding English. I ordered oolong milk tea but received an almond milk tea instead (she remade it for me, though). It was a bit bland, eh. It lacked actual tea flavor and I regretted ordering it.

Their milk tea is a bit generic but I do prefer it over Quickly's which is a few blocks away. I like that their taro milk tea, but my ultimate favorite is jasmine milk tea. I ordered it with "less-sweet" and "more-tea" but it ended up tasting the same to me. The girl who made my drink was the same girl that messed up my drink the first time, so perhaps that's why.

HOWEVER, their popcorn chicken is really good and is hilariously named "salt and paper chicken" on their menu. Try not to laugh when you order it. Comes with real basil leaves, crunchy breading, and the chicken even stays hot and juicy!

I hope that they switch to the sealing lids that Quickly and most tapioca joints use. I don't like the old-school plastic lids because the drinks tend to leak if they're too full. I once dropped my drink (my fault) which resulted in the lid popping off and spilling my whole drink...

They open as late as 11PM which is a plus. I love coming here with my friend after we get off work.
author: Mei H.

description: I usually get my boba in the south bay and have been looking for a boba place in SF for a while.  Sure Teaway is okay, but it's not like fantasia.  Wonderful food is good but it's a bit out of the way for me, and Purple kow has a crazy line.  Sweethut has decent tea, at a fair price which a very short wait! Win!  My friend loved it since they use fresh taro (which we haven't been able to find since sweet delight closed down).
author: Tiffany C.

description: So we wanted a drink with boba and grabbed a papaya milk shake drink....it has been confirmed that this drink smells like vomit.from 10 separate "smellers". Do not buy. I thought it tasted okay, but after the association was made...vomit.
author: Brian D.

description: I got a Lychee Milk Tea with tapioca here and was thoroughly disappointed. This drink should not be on the menu or at least not the way it is made at this establishment. Essentially there were weird chunks of dried lychee floating among crushed iced. The combination of boba texture and weird chunks of lychee was awful. I had to throw out the drink :/
author: Katya O.

description: This is the same owner as wonderful food on Irving. The taste is the same, which is much better quality than all the other bubble tea places. You pay a little more but you don't get the powder taste, like the other places. So much more worth it. We visit every time we're in the neighborhood
author: Jenny L.

description:
Favorite drinks so far

Mango with coconut milk with almond jelly

Watermelon slush with almond jelly 

Lychee milk tea with boba
author: Sally Y.

description: $1.99 delicious milk tea. I also got a peach tea that was really tasty.  They had an assortment of add ins like boba, almond jelly, and lychee jelly. Yummy!
author: Ginger M.

description:
My friend and I stumbled upon this place because of the small chalkboard sign out front

What I like about this place is that they have ALMOND JELLY! :)
I love this stuff when it comes in chinese fruit mix dessert but I never care for the peaches or whatever fruits is the combination... I haven't seen this being offered at too many places or at all?

It was also kinda fun to see them mix the drink in front of you kinda like a bar tender with their martini shaker! They put the ice in the shaker but not your cup with I thought was awesome because the ice would just melt and dilute your drink
(it was a plus with the ice thing cus most of the time i would order an iced- drink without the ice... weird i know but i hate it diluting something like my coffee)

from the time I went, there wasn't much of a line which I really like though there was still an influx/efflux of people ordering drinks

I would try this place again
author: Chloe A.

description:
This place is closer to my house than Wonderful Foods on Irving and it's basically the same thing! Good tapioca for sure.  I've been getting passion green tea and honey green tea lately. They have been a  bit on the sweet side so now I ask for less sweet. They also put a lot of boba in the cup so you might want to ask for less if you want a little more tea. Regardless, I definitely will be here a lot =) 

But anyway, here's a short story about the service. There's a sign on the window about grand opening specials but they don't seem to be accurate because my  mom bought us two drinks that were on the specials poster (or so we thought) and they were just the regular price. Odd. Also, the guys working there were not very good at serving my mom. She ordered my drink for me because I was waiting in the car since there was no parking. One of them understood her that she wanted a honey green tea boba & started making it while the other insisted that that was not what she wanted. Uhh... yes that is what she said! She wanted a honey green tea boba. I know my mom does not speak English well but she knows how to say that much just fine. He should have trusted his coworker. But basically, she had to call me so that I could confirm for him on the phone that he heard right.....
author: Connie Y.

description:
Grabbed a cup of thai tea with boba before lunch.

They make it right in front of you, which was neat.  A real GENEROUS amount of boba into the cup (yay!), with a normal plastic lid with a straw hole.  No plastic wrapped top at this place!

The thai tea was a little tooo sweet, which is hard to come by cause I really like sweet.  Next time, might just take that milk tea special for $1.99 instead.

CASH ONLY!
author: My An V.

description: Grand opening not long ago, and was doing price special so we decided to go after Green Apples and Spices!II indulgence. I personally am a boba snob who doesn't drink powdered boba much, so I requested for fruitier ones. The lychee juice boba end up being perfect! Refreshing, sweet, with plenty of pulps to chew on. I will be back.
author: Dilys S.

description:
First I'm glad this place opened back up as pretty much the same milk tea boba place as it was before. As many reviewers have said, this place is related to Wonderful Foods Co. on Irving Street. 

Even though the Lychee Milk Tea Boba pretty much taste the same as Wonderful Foods Co., I felt there was something missing. Like less lychee chunks or a slightly different taste in the way they make their milk tea at Sweethut. But if you're on Clement, it's definitely better than anything Quickly can make, and you don't have head all the way to Irving to get your fix.
author: Jerold C.

description:
They make a good milk tea here.  Fresh, strong tea taste, and good boba.

  Cheap too, some places are pretty pricy, and they have an afternoon deal sometimes that makes it even nicer.

Looks like an old frozen yogurt place inside, the counter is not quite a milk tea place, and they take a bit of time because everything is confusing for them, but the end product is worth the wait.
author: Rui T.

description: It used to be. one of the first bobas shops in sf in the late 90's.  It's starting to lose its charm from the fancier franchised boba shops.  Is been good times in high school
author: Sandra S.

description: Came in with my mom to get something cold to drink while waiting for our pictures at Walgreens. I ordered #1 Tapioca Milk Tea and my mom ordered #55 Green Bean Tapioca, the service was fast and the people are really nice. They have a piece of paper on their desk which is a petition for them to have self served frozen yogurt. I signed because I love frozen yogurt an if they did open, I will most likely come here regularly. Sign the petition for frozen yogurt!!! =]
author: Jen M.

description:
yes they are owned by same company as Wonderful on Irving.

I tried their mango coconut because of the 1.99 special, which is over now btw. It was okay. the mango was stringy so that was bothersome. 

My friend ordered fresh honeydew... it was orange. not only that.. they HAVE no system for first come first serve!. TERRIBLE. My friend and i ordered together, i got my drink and drank like half of mine and we were still waiting for my friends drink. I went up to the them and asked and they said 'its coming up" i waited another like 5 minutes just staring at the cup being ignored. SO i went up the them again and asked if they were out of honeydew. and the guy just said 'ill make it right now' WTF? no sorry or anything for waiting. they made like at least 15 other drinks before they touched ours. HOW RUDE.

the fresh honeydew was not good. 

Take a look at their menu "salt and PAPER chicken' YUMM?
author: Erica L.

description:
I came here twice for their 1.99 special. The first time I ordered their avocado smoothie with boba and it was so creamy and not-too-sweet, just the way I liked it! The second time I tried their chocolate pudding milk tea, which I thought consisted of chocolate pudding, but instead it was a chocolate milk tea with pudding. I couldn't really taste the tea, it was mostly of milk and artificial chocolate flavor. At first, they got the order wrong and gave me a coffee milk tea instead, but they quickly rectified that without making any fuss. 

The store has a some tall cafe-esque chairs to sit at which were nice and a clean bathroom, but then again, it is only its opening week.
author: Alice L.

description: I did not have a good impression on this place. I never wanted to come here but I was desperate for something sweet. I didn't want any milk tea after the p.m so I just got a honeydew tapioca. It was $2.99 without tax. The drink tasted okay but I thought there was way too much ice that I couldn't get to the tapioca. It's not the worst but there can still be improvements.
author: Carmen L.

description: It's a very average boba tea shop. Nothing to be wowed. The thing I noticed when I walked in was they turned off the lights to save energy. Uhmm... A little tacky? I got the taro bubble tea and it tasted normal nothing amazing. I'd go again for convenience.
author: Jennie C.

description: I have been here several times. Every time the milk tea is toooo sweet and even can taste bitterness and saccharin. Also hurt your teeth a lot. We can not finish the drink. The girl doesn't has good manner. Just because of the good location that makes people go there.
author: Tiff L.

description: I came here last week to order the green milk tea.  They had one made in the shaker that looked like its been sitting there, which they poured me.  It tasted so different from the first time I got it.  I felt like there was coffee in my milk tea.  I didn't like it at all.  It was watered down too.  I don't get why they do this.  Why can't they just measure it correctly the first time so they won't have leftovers to give to the next customers.  No me gusta.
author: Lynn L.

description:
SO HAPPY I FOUND THIS PLACE! I'm happy quickly is no longer my only bubble tea option in the inner richmond. I get their fresh watermelon juice with boba (~$2.50). soo good and refreshing.
I'm excited for when they start selling froyo (the woman said "sometime later") Haven't tried their food.. not sure if I ever will. But I'll definitely be back for more watermelon juice
author: Marisa K.

description: This my go-to place when I'm looking for a cheap and quick place to get my milk tea fix.  I usually order the original milk tea with pearls for only $1.99!  The best thing about this place is that they make it right in front of you and use REAL milk!  The pearls are also perfectly chewy and have just the right amount of sweetness.
author: Kristen T.

description:
so the previous owner of this location was the sibling to the owners of wonderful foods on irving, which just happens to be my favorite boba place of all time.  i was not a huge fan back then because they used non dairy creamer in their milk tea instead of real milk/cream, which to me is sacrilegious.

but now it tastes *almost* the same, with real dairy!

the assembly line here is a mess though.  

2nd best place for boba milk tea in SF!
author: Josie M.

description:
I tried their Wulong Milk Tea after their promotion was over, and I was hooked! Chewy boba at the right consistency! No extra charge to heat up the drink either. The drink was a tad bit sweet, but it was definitely good! The worker was nice & friendly, and the place was actually pretty empty at 12 (noon.) 

I appreciated how the price for the drink included the price of the boba. No hidden fees whatsoever! Definitely might drop in again if I'm in the area!
author: Dana S.

description: This Sweethut almond boba really hit my internal spot today. Clean and refreshing, without it being overly sweet. Clean establishment, and it was crowd-bonkers inside today...like a boba-fest.
author: Derek N.

description:
I came here the first time with a friend and ordered a banana strawberry tapioca, and it was pretty good. Second time I came I just ordered a milk tea tapioca. The drinks are not that bad and they come pretty fast, and of course, cheap. 

There are few things though....

The people behind the cashiers need to speak a little louder when they serve the tapioca drinks on the counters especially when there's more than 5 people waiting. Speaking of waiting, it takes a long time for any of the food to come out of the small kitchen. I ordered french fries and had to wait 15 minutes. A mother and son before me waited a bit longer for their food. 

I will quote my friend "take the fried food off the menu" if it causes too much trouble to have customers waiting for so long. 

Even though I came to this place two times, overall Sweethut is a place to go where you want to have tapioca drinks with a couple of friends or have something better than sodas (hahaha). But if you plan to order any of the fried foods they offer keep in mind how long you may have to wait.
author: Henry D.

description:
I love this place! Especially the prices ($2 during their promotion- until June 15). The fruit drinks are so refreshing and invigorating, as well as very healthy (just be sure to order no sugar). They have more of a shaved ice appeal. The watermelon juice is my favorite so far!
I will definitely come back- at least before the June 15 promotion ends. It is good that most of their drinks still wouldn't be over $3 even after the promotion.
author: T W.

description: One of the few times that yelp has led me astray.  I Really am surprised by the high reviews here. We tried the pearl milk tea and they were over drenched in condensed milk/powder and sugar.  There was barely any hint or taste of tea.  Tapioca was hard and stale.  But most of all-they microwave your drink if you order a hot one. Wow.  No bueno.
author: J C.

description: Cute place, cash only. I really liked that they offered boba made from fresh produce, like the fresh taro boba I got (which is less sweet than the artificial one). Pretty cheap as well.
author: Rowena L.

description: Yummy boba milk tea! $2.49 for a standard size - all other drinks are around $2.99. Rich, sweet milk tea with nice chewy tapioca balls. Fried chicken took a while to come out, but when we finally got our order we were pleased by the serving size and that it came with yummy basil leaves. Definitely will be back. Note: there are 3 or so small tables, so not great for groups, and allow time for parking since Clement St. is always a cluster.
author: Lisa H.

description: Sweet Hut, in addition to Wonderful Foods Co. are my two go-to places for boba. Norman started Wonderful Foods way back when SF didn't even know what boba was. He's continued the awesome-ness by taking up Sweet Hut and churning out all the wonderful boba I love. Lychee milk tea is my favorite. The passion fruit green tea (no milk) has my boyfriend addicted. Everything I've had here is awesome.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Looks like a place you wouldn't bother going in. But despite the looks, this place is really good. Got mango with coconut milk tapioca and it was delicious. Perfect blend and great amount of tapioca. Tapioca was the best and freshest tapioca I've ever had. I feel that it's better than tpumps because this taste more fresh and natural? Made no sense but I can say when I went, my drink was made very well and the tapioca was too good. Great place for a stop of boba drinks.
author: Angela M.

description: Got the green milk tea, light sugar extra boba. Their boba portions are generous so i probably didn't need the extra; loved the chewy consistency but wish the pearls were sweeter. The milk tea was very fragrant. Not among my top 5 spots, but this location is much more convenient so on a non-picky day I'd go back.
author: Judy L.

description: No likey. Boba is too mushy and unflavored for me. Milk in the milk tea is different. Maybe I'm just used to creamer in my milk teas. Also, not so cheap!
author: Karen C.

description: I've been looking for a bubble tea joint that caters to the mocha tapioca bubble tea cravings of both my hubby and I. This place is our favorite, so far, with efficient and friendly service, to boot.
author: Mishka L.

description: prices have gone up a bit, but i love their strawberry banana smoothies with tapioca.  also, they have a very extensive menu
author: Jackie A.

description: Standard boba place, says there's going to be froyo soon. I got the papaya smoothie which was delicious and made with real fruit.
author: David C.

description: Their chairs are super unstable. Anyways, had the strawberry tea w/ something and the honey green tea. The strawberry one was terrible and sweet and fake. The honey green tea was way better and bearable. Overall, quenched our thirst on a sunny day in SF. Ca$h only!
author: Irene L.

description: Essentially the same as Wonderful's but $0.25 cheaper. Interior is pretty similar to all other froyo/asian dessert joints. Not a lot of seats but there really shouldn't be any reason to sit down. The service could be better, the cashier was distracted by her friends that dropped by to visit her to invite her to a party, took her a minute to realize I was still standing there to pay. No biggie though I wouldn't mind going to a party... The drinks came out great. Almond is still my favorite drink whether its hot/cold or with tapioca/almond jelly. Honeydew is my second favorite. Still prefer Wonderful's but this is the definite alternative if I'm in the inner richmond.
author: Ryan L.

description: I used to come here when it was Sweet Delight. Only been once since it changed, but the avocado tapioca drink was just as good as I remember the Sweet Delight one being. I guess the new owner is related to the old one so they are probably using the same recipe. I will come back.
author: Stomparella J.

description:
this is my go-to place for consistently delicious boba in inner richmond, and i'm a richmond girl so i know what i'm talking about!  i love their mango with coconut milk and ii recommend pairing it with almond jelly!!!  SO GOOD!  i also really like their strawberry and cantaloupe fruit juices, both with lemon jelly and their lychee slushee.  their milk tea is not bad either, not too sweet.  

their tapioca is the perfect chewy consistency but i find that they scoop way too much in the cup.  so unless you are okay with pretty much half of your cup filled with tapioca and half of your cup liquid, let the person at the counter know to lay off on the tapioca.  i don't suggest their aloe or rainbow jelly because i find them a little too sour.  

they are cash only and service is super fast!  they whip out these drinks in less than 5 mins, as long as there isn't a line and recently, there hasn't been.
author: Irene W.

description: I always get the honey green tea w/ tapioca from here. They make it pretty on point every time (I HATE inconsistency!!), and the tapioca balls are usually perfectly chewy. They do give a very healthy amount though (think like half your drink is tapioca O_O). $3.50 regular, $4.50 large size
author: Munnie T.

description:
The plain milk tea is definitely good but oddly coffee-flavored. I love coffee-flavored things, but if I want coffee milk tea, I'll specifically order coffee milk tea. Still, I can't complain.

Also, for $1.99...you really can't go wrong, especially when you've been walking a ton and you're sweaty and tired AND a college student on a budget.

-- Props for the ice being crushed/in small pieces. My drinks don't seem as diluted as they would if the ice was regularly sized.

-- Minus some props for not accepting cards. :(
author: Deborah S.

description: The yelp order app does not connect to the actual store?! This is more of a review for yelp, but this needs to be removed!
author: Michael P.

description: I went here a couple of times with my friends. I got their watermelon boba drink. My friends got the other flavors, which I haven't tried yet.
author: Serena Z.

description: After coming here 94723947832x i decided it's only fair to update my reviews. Their milk tea has gotten a lot better! I didn't realize how cheap it was until I was scramming for cash and realized a milk tea is only $2.24, and there's NO LINES! which is pretty awesome. This is my go-to boba place from now on.
author: Nguyet T.

description:
one thing i initially liked about this place is the fact that they hand shake your drinks with the martini shakers.  BUT, it has become that if you order the good old original milk tea with boba, you may not always get a fresh drink or your own individual drink.  

meaning, they premix and preshake a regular milk tea and for some reason uses a shaker that serves more than one milk tea.  so if no one orders another milk tea after the first person orders it, the left over milk tea goes to the next person who orders it.  and that maybe 1 min, 5 min, 10 min and so on. premixed with the ice, sitting there.  getting watery and flat and warm. blah...

i don't know about you, but i don't want a premixed drink with ice that's been sitting around for a while.  come on now, you're different because you hand mix each drink. i am fine waiting for a min or two that it takes to mix the tea with the cream.  so stop the bad habit and use a smaller shaker for the regular milk tea.  stop giving us left overs from someone else's drink.

guys, tell them you want a fresh drink.
author: Food Is L.

description: I never write reviews for PMT (pearl milk tea) places but this was SOOOo good and it's close to burma superstar. I ordered the honey green tea with pearls and the bf ordered the jasmine green tea with pearls. The jasmine green tea was amazing and the pearls were really QQ cooked to perfection :P Plus they still have their $1.99 promo (went there 5/27/2012).
author: Alice S.

description: Gonna cut to the chase on this one...the tea here is awful. The mint green tea is flavored with syrup. The tea is over-brewed and actually gives you a caffeine crash. My bf got the Thai tea but we both got horrible stomach aches. I think this may be due to the baristas pouring too much syrup into our drinks.
author: Amber R.

description: Went back again last night and was reminded how awesome the boba drinks are! Note to readers and reminder for myself: They put too much sugar syrup, so ask for the drink less sweet next time!
author: Jen D.

description: Got the regular hk milk tea. Really good and is only 1.99 right now. Lots of different teas to choose from!
author: Anne L.

description: Just as good as Wonderful, just ALOT closer for me to get tapioca! I LOVE WONDERFUL!!! Cant go wrong with any drinks at this place! Will be here more than Wonderful because of the location!
author: Q W.

description:
Yup, $1.99 for all drinks til mid June.

The place is still a bit rough on the inside - you can tell it used to be a yoghurt place and they haven't really finished remodeling it yet.  Eh...what do you expect, they just opened a week ago or something.  The fresh fruit juices are very good and the aloe has a hint of honey, yum!  I haven't tried any of the food yet.

This place is way better than the Quickly right down the street and the atmosphere is certainly better.  I'll be coming here quite often.
author: Andrew H.

description: I really enjoyed my black passion tea. The boba was chewy and fresh... My drink was just right not too sweet. Customer service was great and prices were fair. Overall a pleasant stress free experience :)
author: Alex A.

description: So glad this place opened on Clement! I no longer need to go to Quickly where their tea quality is like roulette. Anywhoots, I really do like the tea here and love that it's only $1.99. I always get the Jasmine Milk tea and the bf gets the regular milk tea. You can actually taste the tea and not just milk. Next time I'll try the snacks =)
author: Jen L.

description:
Staff = adorable and friendly

Honeydew tapioca = sweet, good, a tad bit too much ice
Lychee milk tea = a little odd tasting. I'd pass.
author: Tiffany M.

description: I love this place. This is one of the few boba joints in San Francisco that does not make your Milk Tea with powder. They use actual black tea and you can taste it! The milk tea was not overly sweet. For $1.99 I would go here over their competitors any day. They also use shaved-ice like bits for your drinks instead of the cubes which is always a plus.
author: Carol W.

description: Just a short note on this SF local legend: I ALWAYS order the Red Bean milk tea when I come here, or the Irving St original store. They don't use red bean powder like those gross Tapioca Express type places. They use real red beans- but the secret is they put the red beans in the blender just long enough to break them up, but not turn them completely mushy.
author: Jesse L.

description: Tapioca drinks for $2.50 (grand opening special)? Yayyy. I'm a fan of their strawberry tapioca. It's sweet and just right. Perfect to grab during my lunch break. I'm waiting for their frozen yogurt stand to open up. I often find myself craving froyo and am sad that we don't have any in the Richmond so I'm very excited for this!
author: Justine O.

description:
Atmosphere was nice.  Enough seating.  Colorful decor.  Fast service.

I ordered a green milk tea with boba.  I tend to like my drinks on the less sweet side, so it was great for me.  Boba had a good chew and decent taste -- and this place is pretty generous with their boba portions.  I'd rate the drink as slightly above average to other tea places in SF.

Partner ordered a milk tea with boba.  Much sweeter and stronger than mine, but still good.
author: Angela T.

description:
I'd give this spot 3.5 stars.

Although they are the same owners of Wonderful Foods on Irving, I still find their milk teas tastier and more satisfying than here at Sweethut. *Something*, I can not distinguish exactly what, is missing or different with my normal drink ( boba milk tea).

Parking can be difficult around this area if you come in the day and later afternoons. I come here because it's slightly closer than Wonderful Foods to me, and yes sometimes, I am just "that" lazy to drive an additional 8 minutes to Irving haha.
author: Shirley A.

description:
Came across while grocery shopping on Clement and I have been back every time I am around this area.
We always have fresh durian and mango smoothies with tapioca pearls. I much prefer this to many other boba tea house where fruit extract were used to mix the drinks instead of fresh fruits. I feel like at least what we order is made fresh. 
Fresh, healthy and satisfying! Love this place.
author: Olivia T.

description: place is awesome!! dropped my mom off a couple doors down to grab dim sum so the hubby and i decided to grab a boba drink. They had SOOOOO many things to choose from, it was almost overwhelming. I got the mocha tapioca boba drink and it was perfect. They are very generous w/ the amount of tapioca balls in the drink, I loved every morsal. The husband got the banana shake tapioca boba and he drank the whole thing before we were able to get back to the car! Great place for a quick drink! Make sure to bring CASH!
author: Kanani S.

description: Just had the honey dew melon flavored tea, and I could have easily had 3 more! They put crushed ice in it, and every sip was sweet, cool, slippery, chewy perfection. Absolutely delicious.
author: Lia M.

description: Same owners as wonderful foods same drinks, go for the mango,red bean,green bean, milk tea or lychee milk tea
author: jonathan h.

description: I totally loved Sweethut! Great vegan boba flavors and they were very flexivle when I asked for low sugar with my coconut milk boba.  Highly recommended!!! :D
author: Sarah B.

description: Came here 1 time, they opened recently, and I had their avocado milk shake drink with boba, and I ordered a papaya drink with boba for my boyfriend.  Both drinks are very good, and very flavorful, not too sweet.  Their boba is very chewy and pretty fresh!  Haven't been to a good boba place in SF in a while.  So I'm glad they are here.  I hope they keep it up. :)  Would love to come back again!
author: Amy A.

description:
I frequent this location a lot during their grand opening specials because every drink was $1.99. My first drink from Here was an avocado snow and I'm not sure if it was because the place was new or what but I don't think the guys working there knew how much avocado to stick into the drink and the drink was really thick and rich with avocado. I went back to have it a second time and it was les thick but still delicious. They give you a ton of boba and I really liked how they used fresh ingredients rather than mixing powders like how Quicklys does it. I also had their honey green tea ans it was pretty good as well. It's just too bad after their promotion was over all the drinks went back to regular price and boy were they really pricy. That we.avocado snow was around $4.50! I can barely spend so much on a 16oz drink! I love this place but I can't frequent it so much because it's pricy.
Minus one star because of the price and during this one visit I had, I had to wait 10 minutes for my order to be done and it wasn't even crowded.
author: Judy C.

description: This is my new place where I get boba when I'm around clement st. I use  to go to quicklys until this place opened. The drinks they make here are amazing. They use fresh fruits in their smoothies A+ for that.  I got the mango smoothie and can taste the mango not the powdery stuff they use at quicklys.
author: Jessica C.

description: unique selections here. including an coconut mango smoothie and coconut papya smoothie. as well as your classics.
author: Hazel F.

description: Mango Coconut Boba tea was not worth $4.xx. Also didn't like that they put in way too much boba in each cup. Haven't tried the regular milk tea or frozen yogurts (machines not in yet) so might give them a 2nd try.
author: Cupcake s.

description: Living in the Inner Richmond, the only milk tea place near by is Quicklys and we ALL know what that's like....Sweethut is refreshing, not too sweet, and has just the right chewiness in their boba. Size of glass is proportional, so it doesn't leave you getting bloated after. I ordered the taro tapioca and it was wonderful! Definitely the new milk tea place to go to in Clement.
author: Nina T.

description:
My first visit was three days ago, and I have been coming back every day since. We ordered milk tea tapioca and salt and "paper" chicken. We got the drinks quickly, but they forgot about our chicken. We told them after about 10 minutes of waiting and they took another 5-10 minutes to make it. While we waited, the cashier offered two free drinks because of our long wait! That definitely made up for it. 

Although the chicken was unique in taste, it was amazing! I normally don't like popcorn chicken that much but this one gets a thumbs up from me. Also, the tapioca seemed to be very caffeinated. My brother said that's "authentic" but I've had authentic milk tea, and it did not taste like this. Either way, it was not bad, but a little strong.

My favorite drinks are the fruit smoothies, they are amazing! They are definitely REAL fruit and you can definitely taste it. Right now, it is $2.50 per fruit smoothie, I can see them raising the price AT LEAST to $3.50 soon because drinks that are this fresh and natural are not worth only $2.50 nowadays.
author: S Z.

description: Good drinks. Just need to learn how to organize who ordered first.
author: GMahree J.

description: Incredible variety of delicious flavors and reasonably priced. Even when there's a crowd, the staff are friendly and quick!
author: Andrew A.

description: The milk tea taste like coffee and the avocado drink really taste like avocado almost like guacamole I think they forgot to put sugar
author: Janine B.

description:
The drinks are pretty good: tapioca is fresh, milk tea is not too sweet or creamy, fresh fruit is really fresh fruit, and they are clear when it's "flavor vs. fresh" which I appreciate. 

I think the service could improve. Not enough people working---sometimes cash register is unattended. Today I waited 25 minutes for my drink, which I think is ridiculous. One girl came in complaining about a drink, then the owner got mad at the drink-maker. 10 seconds later, the associate storms out cursing the establishment. So line is twice as long and they are down one man. I saw him making my drink, but then he gives it to the complaining girl---which is fine, but he should make mine again immediately. 

All these people were nagging "I'm waiting for my watermelon and taro" or "I asked for soy milk---is this soy milk?" and I didn't get my drink. Finally, I go up to the counter, and he notices I have been waiting for a while. He makes my drink---puts it in the wrong cup, gives it to somebody else. 25 minutes after I pay my, I get my drink. It was good, but not worth my time or witnessing the drama. A better system behind the counter would greatly help them out

Willing to come back for a simple drama-free milk tea.
author: Ato Z.

description: place is new and i went all the way from foster city to try their plum tea, but they sold out. got passion fruit milk tea, was ok
author: Ashley C.

description: Good service, they had left over strawberry smoothie in their blender and they offered to give it to me. Told me to drink some and then they added. The drink is decent but a good price.
author: Brendan L.

description: Since I was in the area, I decided to give this spot a try. I ordered a regular strawberry smoothie and asked to make it less sweet. Got the order within 3 minutes, took a sip, and was quite happy with the outcome. It tasted really good and most importantly had a great strawberry flavor to it. I recommend this place if you happen to be in the area and when you do, order a strawberry smoothie because you wont be dissapointed.
author: Kirck P.

description: the fried calamari was some of the best i've ever had - super crispy and flavorful. also ordered the lychee green tea boba which was tasty, but the Thai tea slushy was a bit icy.
author: T. K.

description:
09.20.13 with 1 other

first visit here, good experience.  the service was friendly and quick.
ordered 4 different drinks with boba to go, and my all my friends seemed to like theirs. 
was just under $12 for all 4 drinks - green milk tea, coffee milk tea, fresh watermelon juice and passion green tea.

I got the passion green tea with boba. it was good and boba was not as chewy as other people stated.

no complaints, and will go back if in the area.
author: Jay R.

description: So I'm drinking my avocado tapioca drink. I feel something chewy but it's hard. I'm thinking seed. I get it from my mouth with my hand and to my amazement & shock: I see a piece of twisted metal. It looks like that silver christmas confetti. I showed it to the employee who apologized and said it must have gotten in there when they were cleaning the blender. She offered to make me another one. I stupidly said okay because I was still in amazement/shock of what I pulled out of my mouth. After a minute, my senses came back and realized why would I want another drink from this establishment. The employee gave me a refund and offered me another flavor free drink. I declined. I wasn't thinking of a review at that time or else I would have taken a pic of the silvery/metal object for everybody to see. The cashier did say it was the first time that happened. The place looks pretty clean/decent but still in disbelief what I took out of my mouth.
author: ChiefFinancial O.

description: We found this place to be very enjoyable. Their tapioca was very fresh and tasted delicious. The service was pleasant, friendly, and very efficient. It wasn't too crowded each of the times we showed up. We appreciated that Sweethut offered so many fresh fruit (YAY for fresh taro and avocado!) options for their drinks. We will definitely be back very soon!
author: Chelsea J.

description: I usually get the green milk tea with tapioca. The balls are nice and chewy. The milk tea has just the right amount of milk taste and tea taste. They don't drown the cup in ice. The prices are okay, but I think I've been spoiled by cheaper tapioca places. Overall, I continuously come back here for milk tea if I am in the area.
author: Tracy C.

description: I'm rating this place three stars because they ran out of boba. The milk tea was tasty and good, but the crushed ice made it watery pretty fast. The dudes seem nice and for $1.99 I'll definitely come back. Hopefully they'll have more boba by then.
author: k h.

description: Ever since the old tapioca place closed here, I was so sad because I would never be able to drink their delicious watermelon juice tapioca they offered. BUT this place opens a few months later and I'm oh so glad they did. This place is cheap, has a lot of drink selections, AND ALSO HAS THE BEST WATERMELON JUICE TAPIOCA EVER. It keeps making me come back over and over again. Oh and if you want extra tapioca in your drink, it's free of charge!
author: Hanson T.

description: love me their milk thai tea boba! they also have really good smoothies, but I swear they've had the frozen yogurt "coming soon" sign for months now!
author: K M.

description: I had plum green tea with boba. The drink itself is too sweet for my taste but the boba is cooked very well. Chewy and not over-cooked. This place is very clean (unlike Quickly down the road that has flies everywhere - not an exaggeration at all). Perhaps if you like sweeter boba this would be your place.
author: J P.

description:
definitely better than quickly's but i have had better boba.

the place itself deserves 5 stars - super clean and comfortable decor.

on this trip, i ordered the regular milk tea with tapioca and jasmine milk tea. the regular milk tea was wayyyy too sweet and the tapioca seemed like it had been sitting on the counter for awhile. the jasmine milk tea was really good. it was not too sweet and the tea flavor really stood out.

will revisit if i am in the area but not a place i would purposely drive to. (not a parking friendly neighborhood)
author: Julia A.

description: way better than quickly's.  this place is clean, fast and service was friendly.  will be back
author: Damien R.

description: The WORSE customer service I think I have ever had. One, this place sucks because when you order your drink, there's no reciept and the cashier just tells the other person what to make. What's wrong with that? WELL, if there's ten more people ordering drinks, obviously the person making the drink is going to forget yours. WHICH IS EXACTLY WHAT HAPPENED TO ME. I waited a good 10 minutes and asked the lady where my drink was. The lady said she was making it. She placed it and didn't even call what the drink was - so some other people grabbed it. About another 5 minutes passed by and she still hadn't called the drink I ordered. My mother decided to go up to the cashier and speak to him about it. The woman making the drink didn't even apologize, she just said "What's your problem?" The cashier just told us to grab any drink. (I got milk tea with tapioca even though I ordered Green milk tea.) It sucked. The tapioca balls are freaking disgusting. Save your two bucks for Quicklys or Purple Kow because Sweethut is gross.
author: Amy C.
